text: Great food and waitstaff! Must try the lobster bisque and meatballs. The chopped salad is great as well! The chicken fettacini with rosa sauce amazing!!! All and all a great place to eat if you want Italian downtown!

After a great weekend in Vegas my boyfriend and I decided to head downtown to have lunch and gamble a bit before heading back home. I have been to the Golden Nugget, where this restaurant is located many times, but never ate here. Oh man, I was pleasantly surprised. I went in expecting typical Italian fare, a la Olive Garden, but I got much more. The calamari appetizer was amazing, tasted fresh and not too over fried. I ordered the chicken parmigiana, while my boyfriend ordered the Chicken Marsala. His came with an Italian salad, which was also pretty good for a salad. When our meals came we were amazed by the portion sizes. If I wasn't starving I probably could have saved half for another meal, the chicken piece was about the size of my face. Not even kidding. The boyfriends Chicken Marsala was about the same amount of chicken, just cut up and laid over a bed of mushroom risotto. Everything that I tasted here was amazing and the service was on point. I will for sure be back next time I come to town.

Sat at bar for a sandwich.  Bartender was very nice.  He recommended a good draft beer.  Ordered a sandwich then looked up and saw the B health rating.  Hope I won't be hugging the toilet tonight.  (I subtracted one star for health rating)

**note....3 days later and no sickness!  WOOT!

Food was great. My husband and I ordered a salad and a shrimp asparagus Fettuccini entree. It was just enough for the two of us . the waitress was very friendly and helpful. Even though it was early for dinner and the restaurant was empty, it took a while to be served.  The bread was delicious!  The best ever! We sat next to the window that overlooked the fish tank. It was a very pleasant dinner.
Pleasantly surprised!  Large portions. Chicken Milanese was delicious. Kids loved the bolengnese. Salted caramel cheese cake was to die for!

This place is a must try if you are in the downtown Fremont St part of Vegas. The food and service is great. It is really hard for me to give good rating to an Italian restaurant, but this one truly deserves it. We definitely plan to eat here the next time we are in Vegas.

Pretty good food and not horribly overpriced. Wife and sister-in-lkaw ordered Lemon Drops and thought them the worst drinks they'd ever had. They asked for them to be replaced with something else and were immediately granted that request. Portion size a bit small of you're a big eater.Delicious bread.

We came on a Friday night for dinner, and booked a table through Open Table. And we are also Landry Club member. So we would think that it would be a nice dinner. It turned out that the dinner was an upsetting experience because of a very bad server.

We ordered a Capricciosa Pizza and ONE caesar salad. When the salad came, we were given 2 half salads. I was already feeling weird about it. When we ordered, we did say A caesar salad. We didn't say "two half caesar salads". And we weren't asked if we would like to split it too. But it came out split. So I wasn't sure what was going on. I didn't even know that we would be charged more for comsuming the 2 half salads. We just thought that maybe they were nice enough to split it into 2 portions. We weren't asked at all so and the menu didn't even state any option of half salad of splitting salad. So we didn't have any clue that we should have asked about it before putting the salad into our mouths. Besides, the server was very not attentive to us while she was attentive to every other tables she served. So we were like "what's wrong with her?"

At the end the check came, we were charged for 2 half salads instead of 1 full portion of caesar salad. 1 full portion of caesar salad costs $9.99 but 2 half salads cost $11.98. So of course we were upset about it! The server was being unfair to us to make the call of splitting the salad without even asking us first. I feel that she should be the one paying our meal because of how she treated us (see below).

We are really upset with the server. The server always attempted to take away our food while we were still working on it. When we were working on the pizza, when there was still half a pizza left on the pizza plate, the server attempted to take away our pizza and said "you are all done?" We said "no, we are still working on it. What kind of manner was that?? She could have asked if we are still working on the pizza without any action done first. She did the same when we were working on our dessert. She was so off, way too off. I was nice enough to write $2 as tips for her at the end. She really didn't deserve any tip as that's not called service. She doesn't deserve any gratuity when she was trying to rush people out of the restaurant. But I did observe and she was nice to all other people. And I really had to come down to a conclusion that she might be a racist!
We got so upset. And I was very hungry and tired that night so I didn't have the energy to think what I could have done while we were still at the restaurant. So after taking a shower that night, my mind got clear and I was able to think. Then I realized how stupid I was as I should have brought it up to the manager, and I shouldn't have given her any tip (It's not about money, it's about teaching her a lesson, if she is going to have tip with such a horrible manner, she is going to continue doing that as she thinks she's entitled). So the other morning, we went to the restaurant and spoke with the manager about how unfair it was that we were charged for 2 half salads while we didn't ask for it. And we were upset at the server rushing us. The manager felt very sorry about it so she treated us lunch afterwards. We got a lasagna and a caesar salad again for lunch.

The food is worth 4 starts honestly. The pizza, the lasagna and the salad were worth 4 stars. The dessert Strawberry Cassatta was worth 3 stars, it was not bad tasting, just not surprising either. We were just so upset with the server so she made the whole experience 2 stars. The manager was worth 4 stars as she was nice, sincere, was very reasonable and understanding us. I just feel bad for them to have a bad apple being a server, who has the potential to ruin the reputation of the restaurant so badly.

We are giving 2 stars for this review because of the bad server we had for the dinner. 

The lunch that the manager treated us actually deserved 4 stars, we also had a different server for that lunch too. We accepted the apologies and will still try Grotto again in the future when we visit vegas, especially because we really like their pizza and lasagna. We will just have to make sure that we won't have that bad server ever again in the future when visiting Grotto, and probably ask for another server if we unluckily get another bad one in the future.

Dined here on Wednesday night. We stayed on the Strip, but we are SO happy we found this restaurant. Fresh bread and olive oil for the table. Great calamari. I had the Gorgonzola pasta and my husband had the lasagna. Both were fantastic!!!! Highly, highly recommend this establishment. Price point is great. Absolutely delicious!

We went here accidentally because we didn't know where to eat since we tried to go to Lillie's Asian Cuisine but it was closed for lunch and we went to go to Market Street Cafe to try their famous oxtail soup but the oxtail soup was not available until 11 pm. So we decided to go to Grotto, boy we were glad we came here. 
We ordered: 
- fried calamari comes with their yummiest tomato sauce (i never like tomato sauce but this one is so delicious i ate it clean), the calamari was dry not oily like other restaurant.. very good.
- lobster bisque ... very good. the best lobster bisque beside the one i tried at the four seasons hotel san francisco. They gave a good chunk of lobster meat.. so delicious. Just don't order it to go because i liked it so much i ordered it to go and they didn't give the lobster meat at all.. so disappointed.
- chicken alfredo linguine.. good, the white chicken meat is good but it is not grilled like what i expected, i think it was sliced roasted chicken but the overall is good because it is not greasy not too much butter and i didn't feel bloated after that.

Their bread was good, served warm and so yummy, one of the best bread but you have to ask because they won't give out the bread unless you ask for it.

The only thing that was off: the food took a while to get out, we had to wait for each of the food to get out and the restaurant was not even crowded.

We had an excellent experience. It was my Uncle's 82nd birthday and we happened upon The Grotto on a Sunday evening. The server was great, the food arrived quickly and was very good. We had 2 Italians that were discussing their family recipes so I thought it would be a tough sell. They were both impressed with the meatballs and praised their entrees as well. Reasonably priced, great atmosphere for being in a casino setting and friendly servers.
Loved the food, probably one of the best Italian pasta dishes I have had. Wait staff was a little slow but very friendly. Wish they were in Austin.

Had dinner here just by chance after visiting the Fremont street area. Very very impressed with the service, quick seating and atmosphere. The food was amazing especially the warm fresh baked bread. AMAZING. Will return

Went here yesterday (Wednesday) around 5 pm. After we perused the menu at the hostess stand and showed interest in the pizza-of-the-day, the hostess told us the pizza was only $8 in the bar because it was happy hour. Sweet! She pointed us to a table in the bar, where we sat. And sat. And sat. There were two waiters working the two tables next to us while completely ignoring us. One actually stood at the bar chatting with his friends. Seriously? After 6 minutes of being ignored, we left. There are lots of restaurants around, too bad you don't care to pay attention to us.
We ordered two pasta dishes and wine. The wine was good but the food was over seasoned and pricey. Lots of damage. YES. lots =(
The pizza is fantastic and the atmosphere is perfect. Don't listen to all the naysayers, for the price this place is a great deal.

Menu looked promising as we walked by, so we made reservations before seeing Gordie Brown show for all six of us. 
The hostess was pleasant, and the waitstaff was attentive (initially).  Ordered a herb roasted chicken pizza. Good.  Not  great. Very little toppings. Tried a slice of friends pepperoni pizza and promptly kicked myself for not ordering that. The pepperoni was outstanding. 
Once dinner was completed, our waiter sort of...disappeared.  took a while to get the check (remember, we had tickets to a show).  All in all a good experience.

I don't think that there are any good restaurants in downtown.  This was possibly the worst food I have had.  The pizza was soggy, cold, and had no flavor.  The lobster soup was fishy.  The best part of the meal was the wine...enough said.

My husband and I took my parents here when they visited last week. We are special case because my mom is very allergic to onions. Italian is not a cuisine we usually have much luck with since pretty much everything has onion. We asked the waitress, a very lovely woman I cannot remember her name, what didn't have onion to narrow down the sizeable menu. She went to the kitchen to check with the chef whom came to our table to speak with us. Not surprisingly Chef Paul (I believe was his name. Many cocktails were had that night lol) informed us essentially all dishes were made with onion and since it's in the sauces there wasn't an option to make them without. BUT if there was anything she wanted even if it was off menu to let the waitress know and he would oblige. My mom ordered a Shrimp Scampi with Linguini and she could not stop praising the flavor! She was especially grateful for the understanding. 
As for the rest of us, we all thoroughly enjoyed our meals and the desserts were phenomenal.

The food was AMAZING!!!!!!!! Oh my gosh so good!! The service, however, was far from amazing. She talked badly about other tables that she had at the same time,  and got our salad and one of our dinners wrong. It took a while to get the right one, but when we did get it, it was really really good. Try the strawberry cake! Soooooooooooo good!!!!!

Really awesome place next to the shark tank and the staff was really cool about reservations and finding us a table. The pizza and pasta was pretty good as well but not to die for. Fun night but probably won't go out of our way to go here again.

We had a terrible experience.  Our server was doing an OK job till he told us he had to go on break and someone would be taking care of us.  In the fifteen minutes that he was gone, not a single person came to check on us or clear our plates.

The bread was good and that's it. UGH!! I ordered the lasgna and honestly it ididn't even look, smell, or taste like real meat.  I sweat it looked like some kinda of mystery meat and it smelled terrible after i scooped it off the layers and set it to the side.  I felt sick after eating and all I had was the layers of noodles and the cheese.

My friend had some kind of pasta and said it was too sweet.

Poor service. Terrible food.  Overpriced.  I will not be going back. Stay away. Try Trevi at Caesars--way better!

The food is here is fantastic. I ate there four times in five days. You can't go wrong with anything- except the service. If I was judging this based on food alone, Grotto Would get ten stars. 

It takes forever to get a table. But it's Vegas- I get it. However, we had one waitress in particular who walked over to the table twenty minutes after we were sat, and instead of saying hello, said "I hate people from Boston." Well, one member of our party is from Boston and found it especially rude. Later in the meal the waitress was ranting about the zombie apocalypse. Again, I understand this is Vegas, but it's still a 20$ a dish restaurant and people are trying to have a good meal.

We enjoyed our delicious meal on our visit to the restaurant. Our server Angela was awesome. She is such a pleasure and made sure our meal was exactly had what we expected. Robert the manager was also a pleasure to talk to.

Staying at the Nugget and looking for a nice dinner close by. Went to the Grotto around 6 on Monday. No reservation needed, although the place started filling up an hour later. 

Service was a little spotty at first, but got better as the meal progressed. The fresh bread and seasoned olive oil was excellent. I had the Pollo Francese, which was just slightly overdone, but still good. My wife had  the Shrimp Griglia, which she liked. Just enough garlic to require a stick of gum after, but not enough to taste the next morning!

The best deal of the night was a Rigatoni Bolognese special for $10. Two of our friends ordered that dish, and they both felt they got their money's worth. 

One disappointment is the inability to order a side salad with dinner. One of our party asked, and she was directed to the main salad menu, starting at $10. Missed opportunity, folks. You likely would have sold several salads at $5, but instead we kept asking for the free bread. 

If you're looking for an easy, somewhat upscale alternative to standard downtown fare, the Grotto is a nice go-to in a pinch.

I have eaten here several times and always find the food to be good and the portions filling. The desserts are huge and good and the antipasto is excellent. The pastas are good and of a good size. The prices are very reasonable for a Vegas restaurant especially in a casino.

My husband and I go to the Grotto in the Golden Nugget for dinner whenever we are going to be Downtown for the evening.
Our favorite waitress is Denise Martin who always remembers us by name. Although my favorite meal is the spaghetti bolognese they do have Specials that can tempt me to try something different. Last night my husband said the shrimp and spaghetti Special was the best meal he has ever had. We have never been disappointed by the dinner or the service whenever we go to the Grotto.

Leo and Kai were definitely my best friend's and I's  favorite bartenders here. Super sweet, helpful, and they both know how to make a damn good Pina Colada as well as the best Apple Martini. Will make a special trip just to come here whenever we vacation!

Food delicious, staff has issues.  The barmaid and wait staff bickering in front of us at bar.  After being seated our waitress was absent minded and kept forgetting what we ordered. Asked for a water refill took her 20 minutes after she walked by twice and I asked again.  Recommend staff service training.  But the food was good.
Good atmosphere. Great pizza- thin crust, fresh ingredients. The meatballs- Mama Mia!!-great flavor. Our waitress was fun and efficient.

By far the worst meal we have ever had!!!!!! I don't mind paying top dollar for a great meal but this was a joke. First we started with breakfast . We arrived at 10:30 am and was told breakfast was over but could still order an omelette..my husband did but all I wanted was toast and coffee.. Omelette was ok but toast was cold, limp and soggy. Come on!  Can get toast right.  For some reason I let my husband talk me into going back for dinner.. I ordered the veal house special. I asked the waiter about it and he said it was the highest quality veal and his personal favorite. At $24.99 a dish I figured it was worth it to get the highest quality veal.  Omg.. It's came out of a freeze for sure. I received 4 tiny medallions all the exact same size with 1 slice of a mushroom on top . It was so breaded that any veal that might have been in it was lost forever. I would beat it came out of the freezer.. It was cold and the worst piece of something I ever ate. My husband ordered the pasta which was the smallest portion I have ever seen ($20.00). I was soooo disappointed .. The waiter knew I was not happy and did offer to replace my meal with something else. At that point I said forget it.  If I could give a negative number review I would.

Food was great. Only 3 stars because you stare at gross people at the pool (you might lose you appetite) or people shuffling through the middle of the restaurant. It's loud and hard to enjoy your meal. 4 stars for the service we received.
Great food, drinks, and service! Definitely recommend this place to locals and visitors.

I dont know how this people give 5 stars for the food they must have terrible taste. Imo the Mahi  dish was terrible, in fact I didnt eat half of the dish because it it was that bad. The patatoes were way overcooked had no seasoning, looked burned and tasted old. The fish had a very bad taste to it. I had mahi before so I know how it tastes. The 3 piece of veggies that came with it didnt wow me either. If you charge $30 for a fish meal then deliver a $30 worth of a meal and not fast food style frozen food. The whole meal tasted like they took frozen fish warmed it up in the microwave and served it. Not fresh at all. Overall very disappointing experience for the money spend.

Excellent food with exemplary service.  Jennine provides expert guidance, professional service, and has more training and knowledge that this particular menu and venue can contain. Great pizza, pasta, wine, and dessert! Don't miss the calamari.  Magnifique! We will always return to this location, and expect greatness. An added plus-- dinner and a show! Tables overlook the Golden Nugget pool, a vibrant show of a large variety of curiosity and humanity.  Enjoy!
Decent food, sub par service. Our waiter was definitely a downer and made us feel we made the wrong choice.

Had a great time on our last night in Vegas.  After spending the day at Hoover Dam and really needing some refreshments when we returned to the hotel we decided to just stay in and eat in house.  First of course we had to spend time at the bar and quaff a few (ok, way more) cold ones, enjoy the ambiance and a nice guy bar tender named Andy.    Andy even provided some bread with olive oil dip later on (I guess there's a name for it, but all I know is it hit the spot after much beer) when we decided to make a reservation and just eat there.  After an hour or so wait (and more beer) we sashayed (ok, stumbled) into the main room to enjoy some delicious Italian food.  Excellent shrimp cocktail followed by (by me) some spaghetti with meatballs and sausage, ( I wanted old school), were served by Arturo our waiter, in a friendly and efficient manner.  We even had some GREAT cheesecake and other deserts, which on top of the beer and food made me so happy later on that the wife remembered to pack the bottle of Tums. Andy the bartender even stopped by to say hello and say he enjoyed talking to us while we were getting bombed at the bar.  A great experience all the way around.  Staying at the Golden Nugget is always fun for us, but being able to eat and drink (to excess even) and have such a great time and excellent meal at the same time and place made it even better.  Looking forward to next time.  Thanks Grotto.

I've eaten here 3 times. Tomato soup is delicious, I love the bread and oil. Fried mushrooms and lasagna are good as well. Went for happy hour and had peach bellinis that were very tasty and their herb chicken pizza. Pizza was crispy and flavorful. Also we tried their spinach and artichoke dip, it was decent. I prefer the soft bread to the harder croutons. Tiramisu was very delicious too.

Service on a Thursday in early January was slooowwwww! 

Wine was good, spinach and pear salad was enough for two to share and fabulous, bread and olive oil, yummy. I had the very tasty ravioli alla vodka which was excellent. Another diner at my table ordered the penne con gamberi al limone which was a bit too lemony for my taste but if you like your hot pasta lemony then go for it! 

I would eat here again but the service needs to be a bit more attentive.
Jeff is great!  Although I stay on the strip, always make an effort to come here for the pizza!   One of my fav pizza spots for sure!
Food was great but the hostess needed an attitude check and the website needs updating. It shows the hours to be 1100-1100 but per the hostess "well we close at 1030 today" (with the attitude)

The restaurant is very clean and well presented upon entry.

My wife had the fried cheese ravioli, which was listed as an appetizer, for her meal.  I had the chicken alfredo.  The chicken was moist and cooked beautifully, just not blackened enough for my liking.

Overall the service was prompt and responsive.  For an appetizer, an entree, and 2 waters of this caliber I would expect to pay between $15 and $18.  Our bill was $28.  

Again, I say you are paying for the service and location, not the quality of food.
Simply amazing!  The food is outstanding.  Love this place and the service was excellent!

After reading a few reviews here, I scooted downstairs to the Grotto Ristorante for the meatballs, Signature frozen peach Bellini, & Tiramisu. I am stuffed & my mouth is so happy. They sat me in the fresh air section that looks out on the pool I saw once in CSI with the shark tank. It is actually INDOORS, thankfully, because it was 108 degrees on the other side of the glass. Everything was delicious & Lilly was a wonderful waitress. I went a bit early for dinner...4:30 ish, but in my time zone it was already 6:30. There were a few other customers, but not crowded at all, so no waiting.

We Keep Returning, It's Good"

Service, excellent! Food, very good. We all enjoyed our meals... but, I ordered the chicken diavolo and it didn't have any diavolo (spice heat). Otherwise it was still good. Objection... coffee at $3.50 is a little out of whack compared to the rest of the menu pricing.

I stopped in here my first night in Vegas and the waitress forgot my dessert. Service was also off. After mentioning this in my initial review, Upper management reached out to me to make things right. I then went back with a party of 9 people and they were exceptional! Jose our waiter was on point with service and even took photos for us! The food and appetizers were very good, everyone had a great meal and a great time! Thank you guys for making us fans! We will definitely be back!
Very expensive for the quality of food you are getting here.  Spaghetti bolognese was not amazing at all.  I've had better in Nebraska.
Myself and my party had an excellent experience eating while served by Angela. We thoroughly recommend coming here. Thank you for going above and beyond while serving us!
Great Italian restaurant . Awesome service, the wait staff were very attentive. Food was authentic and flavorful.  The  Grotto's ambiance is perfect for a date.

Great food we had a Caesar salad, Alfredo and tomato soup. I think we would all say the tomato soup was the best but they were all good. They serve French bread with a garlic olive oil. 
 Very relaxing with a glass of wine, good food, great company and a view of the pool. 
One final note the server was friendly and checked on us several times throughout the meal. There was no wait, however that said it was two in the afternoon.

Tomato Basil soup was delicious but a little pricy. Waited over half an hour for it (server must have forgot). Meatzza pizza was tasty, didn't care for the meatballs on it though.

Overall food was good; service was painfully slow.

Been here a couple of times for decent italian fare. Stopped in for a pizza and beer on on a Friday afternoon. The pizza is a thin crust cooked in a wood fire oven, and is delicious, and the beer selection is decent. The service, however, is where we have a problem.

I found our server to be inattentive, scatterbrained, and borderline rude, all in one service. I've beed served by her before, and noticed some of these attributes previously, but this time, I'd had it. My wife and I ordered a beer and a glass of wine respectively. These took what felt like an eternity to bring to us. Once we got our food at the table, she flat out ignored us, failing to check up on us once. I'm sure the manager would be unhappy to know she lost 2 more beverage sales as a result. I know we weren't a high ticket table, but that doesn't mean you can give bad service. What was more annoying is we got to overhear how personable she could be while serving the two ladies at the adjacent table. When check time came, she dropped it and vanished like a vaudevillian magician in a puff of smoke before I could hand her my Landry's Select card. When I gave it to her, she acted as if it was a huge pain, and I should have told her sooner.  How could I? She was damn near avoiding interacting with us!

Now, I know there are two sides to every story. Usually when I read complaints about servers, I am open to the possibility that there is a reason the reviewer got bad service. Perhaps they were rude to the server, smelled bad, who knows. Let me tell you, I was raised to respect what a shitty job waiting tables is. I say please, thank you, and appreciate the grind. My wife is the same way. So I can honestly say that the attitude was totally unwarranted and from left field. As a result, I left an appropriate 15% tip and bailed. I will be sure to not be seated in her section again.

Kinda odd place to dine since I'm a local here with no habit of gambling, and I have no business coming to LV down town... but wow, I have to say, this is the place you can come to get the great lunch/dinner for affordable price! I had a bowl of tomato soup and I splitted goat cheese chicken pizza. Bill was no more than $25 I believe... and I felt like I was at spago! Soup was simple and perfect, not too acidic and basil played nice side kick to it. Pizza had so much flavor, I rubbed my tongue many times just to taste everything in my mouth. Very satisfying. My friend ordered a plate of lasagne and it was also out of this world too. Great ambience, not too crowded, and it stays open at weird time (like 3pm where everywhere else closes down). Highly recommended!!

We were pleasantly surprised in our meals.  They make a really good lasagna.  It was insanely busy, and it seemed like the kitchen was struggling to keep up.  Our waiter was very friendly, too.  Definitely a good value.

If you're Italian and know good Italian food... Don't go here. We saw the good reviews and figured we'd check it out... Let's just say we were disappointed. We started off with the spinach artichoke dip and that was eh... Lacked flavor. My boyfriend got the veal kickerillo and could barely eat it. I had a pasta dish and it was ok. I really wouldn't recommend this place unless you're looking for cheap Italian food.
Went to grotto's at the golden nugget, it was so good we came back again and ate. If u come to downtown vegas you won't be disappointed here. Food, service and atmosphere is all very very good.
The food is good. Don't get the antipasto. Very plain, too many olives. Sat at the bar, service was not great. Over priced.

The only good thing about our experience with this restaurant was the view of the fish tank out by the pool. 
First the waitress forgot our drinks. Then when she did bring our drinks, or should I say drink, she forgot my wife's wine. Fine, we told here to just make sure that it was not on the bill. 
We ordered a pasta plate, and a chicken margarita pizza.
Pasta, well, to be honest, was so, so, but not bad.
The pizza, oh, the pizza........ it was absolutely the worst thing I have eaten in a long time. For me to spit out my food in a restaurant, wow, something has to be horribly wrong. Well it was. The chicken tasted like it was 2 weeks old. No joke, no exaggeration, old chicken has to be one of the worst things you can put in your mouth. Now imagine a piece of pizza you had just bitten into being covered in it!!!!
We informed the waitress, who must be an out of work actress, because she said that she could not believe what we were telling her and that she would look into it with the chef.  
So we waited for some kind of response as to what may have gone wrong, after about 15 min of waiting, the manager comes over and tells us that he cannot belive that the chicken was like that and that the chef was looking into it. Then he just walked away. No joke, no apologies, no comping the meal, nothing, he just repeated the same thing to us that the waitress had told us 15 min earlier and walked away!!!
My wife and I were going to walk out, but, unfortunately for us we have ethics. Finally we were able to get the attention of our waitress and got our bill, paid for the food we had eaten and left. 
Please don't ever eat here, I don't want you to have to find out what old chicken, and I mean really old chicken taste like, the way that we had too.
Also, to be treated so cold by the manager, and a forgetful waitress is absolutely unacceptable. In today's economy businesses need to appreciate any and all customers who walk into their establishment. 
Never, ever again.

The best place to eat on Freemont Street!  Their pizzas are my favorite in the West (I.e. not Chicago or New York).  In previous visits I've had several of the appetizers,  salads and pastas.  All were good.  At happy hour you can get the full size pizza for half price.

Was fairly empty... Hostess sat us next to the kitchen anyway... Waiter was preoccupied with conversations with what seemed to be the manager... Forgot to put our order in... Food was really late, with no apology...  The food was ok... Pizza is the best thing we ordered... Our bill was $120 for 4 people with a bottle of wine... Not bad but the service and vibe was really bad.

We've been here twice now during a regular trip to Vegas for business.  This last time I had the Spinach & Pear Salad.  Amazing!!! (Baby spinach, Bosc pears, tomatoes, caramelized pecans, Gorgonzola and balsamic vinaigrette)  Then I finished it off with their gorgeous thin crust Margherita pizza fired up in the brick oven behind the bar.  Normally at an Italian place I would go for a nice pasta dish but this hit the spot PERFECT.  That salad was amazing!  We ended the night with a leisurely stroll for the downtown Fremont Experience that only this off the strip location can offer.  SO worth the short drive off the strip!  I only wish I had room for their ginormous desserts.  Next time...
The best meatballs I have ever tasted and amazing service. The best part of Vegas is getting amazing food any time of the evening.

Although the food had excellent flavor, 2 out my group of 4 had severe food poisoning. I myself had the Lobster Bisque, which had excellent flavor but had a tiny amount of lobster in it. The two that got sick had their pepperoni pizza and the lasagna. Didn't expect to spend the last day in Vegas recovering...

Prices were fair and service was great.

i swear they have a lil old gramma in the basement ball and chained to the wall making the meatballs. they were awesome.

we say by the pool at night and watched the fish go round and round. it was nice.

the food A ++ 
the service.
well it sucked. hardcore. some of the worse i have ever had. we really wanted a sweet treat after dinner to celebrate our winnings...after waiting 45 mins for the waitress to come back..wine glasses empty..etc..
we said screw it. paid and left.

but man the meatballs. 
yumm.

We came to this restaurant on a whim after hanging out on Fremont Street, and it was one of the best impulse decisions made. The service was stellar -- even though we happened to show up while there was also a large party being served, the staff was very attentive to us as well as the other smaller tables. The food was excellent -- warm loaves of bread with garlic and basil infused olive oil for dipping are provided to every table, and we followed it up with perfectly tender calamari. Every person at my table had excellent reviews for our entrees, and understandably with a very large party ahead of us, the food was slightly delayed coming out, but honestly I've been to places like IHOP and waited far longer. Because of that little delay though, the manager provided dessert for free. 

Which comes to the highlight of the dinner: the strawberry cassata. If you come to this restaurant you cannot leave without trying this Italian wedding cake or you're simply wasting your time. So light and fluffy and moist, I can confidently say it was the best dessert I've ever had. Every future trip to Las Vegas for me will include stopping at the Grotto for their strawberry cassata on my itinerary. 

Special shout out to Carol of the wait staff, such a lovely and enthusiasticand funny woman!
best pizza in vegas hands down (do not fold em)

One star reserved as the prices are ridiculous. This is not a high end bar! It's a casino bar for craps sake.... That said. Friendly chatty bartenders are attentive and informative! I ordered Fire and Ice ( cinnamon whiskey , pi√±a colada mix and pineapple) yum! Very professional staff! Will be back for their Happy hour and some of that awesome pizza!!

Love. That is what I feel for this place after having dinner here. The service was friendly and spot on. I ordered the Herb Chicken Pizza and nearly died it was so good. I highly recommend this place!
Kim was enthusiastic and has a great sense of humor; she is definitely an asset to this restaurant. She did great with our order.

Very nice setting and good service from our server Denise. The food though is not what everyone is hooting and hollering about. I ended up getting an appetizer for an entree that was nicely done, and fantastic flavor. The husband got a pizza that wasn't cooked long enough and really wasn't anything spectacular. He ended wishing he got what I ordered.
Had a pizza to-go. Served up right-a-way. Pizza is. New York style thin-crust. Very tasty. Would go again.
A great restaurant, the best pizza I've tried so far, the price was great. The food was absolutely phenomenal. I will definitely return in the near future.

We arrived at exactly 10.30, when it is end of orders. One person told us they were open, the other told us they were closed. But they sat us and took an order, so I expect the service to be normal. Anyway, waitress was polite enough, but didn't know when to leave the table, just carried on chatting. There was an occasion when she called over another waiter and they both stood there while we are trying eat. Quite uncomfortable. You have to know when to leave the table. Pasta sauce was WAY TOO SWEET. When I mentioned it to the waitress she just said it has to be that way because the recipe is set by the owner in Texas. All his restaurants have to do it the same way. No apology or understanding. I was going to order a bottle of red wine, but when I saw the prices I nearly choked. There was a wine I like that I can get (1500 miles away) in my home town for $11 at the local liquor store. In this restaurant it was gonna cost me $55. No way man. It aint a fine wine, and it's only from California NOT ITALY).
Wife's margerita pizza was okay though, but a little soggy. Stuffed mushrooms were good but again, a little sweet on the sauce. Overall, not a pleasant relaxing experience. Too many different staff serving the table. I am Italian, and the food is not very authentic.  Do some homework, find where local Italians eat and get a cab there, the money you spend on the taxi will be made up for by the meal. We wont be coming to Grotto again, even thpough we LOVE the Golden Nugget

Wanted to check out Fremont St in Vegas so drove over to Golden Nugget & stumbled upon Grotto. Ordered their Bruschetta which was SERIOUSLY THE BEST EVER!!! It was so fresh & delicious and had a balsamic glaze drizzled o er the tip which was divine!
Our server, Jason was a true professional...exceptional service!!!
We ordered their Meatza pizza and a small Italian salad. Both were delicious!
I highly recommend the place if your up for some great Italian food! They have their own pizza ovens, a nice bar area & deserts to die for!!!

Grotto was perfect for a nice, romantic dinner with my wife. We were staying at the Golden Nugget Resort and so the location was ideal. The food was amazing and the prices were reasonable. We will definitely be back.

I had dinner at the grotto and had a drink at the bar. I was served by a gentleman by the name Jeff. I have to say I had an outstanding experience there. I would recommend anyone visiting down town Las Vegas to go to the grotto and stop at this bar/ restaurant.

Had a truly great dining experience here. Our server was very helpful with our groups indecisiveness and recommended the signature pizza to share and the garlic olive oil for the bread was outstanding. I wish they sold that stuff in a bottle. The only complaint was the wait which was understandable given it was a crazy friday night with loud obnoxious drunk people rampart throughout the restaurant causing chaos and disorder. If you want authentic Italian food that is not a far cry from downtown, this is the place.

What can I say...gotta love the Golden Nugget.
Lunch at Grotto right by the pool is a great way to do a business meeting.

Delicious food, friendly staff, and great atmosphere.
Had a great dinner.  Relaxing atmosphere and our waitress,Cynthia, gave us recommendations for dinner that were excellent.

First time here and I love their service.   The food is incredible!!   My husband and I asked for recommendations of food and she hit it right on the head.  Yummy and they serve big portions.  The atmosphere is so welcoming and the guests are enjoying themselves.  Love it here!!  Will be back.

This place was pretty tasty. I liked the setup next to the pool where you can watch all of the sharks and fish in the tanks. It isnt really close but close enough to enjoy the setting. 

Food.. well it was pretty good. I had chicken and it was tasty.. Not the best in the free world but it was good enough to go back. I liked the servers who were pretty cool and on it with drink service. I got tons of water refills and vodka tonics one after the other.. So overall I would return

Anybody who goes downtown must eat here.  We actually stay at the Golden Nugget in part because of this restaurant.  I was blown away to discover this is part of a chain. I find the food to be almost perfect everytime I come here.

The service and the setting are very good if not perfect. The food though is what steals the show at this restaurant. Every dish that you try explodes with flavor and freshness. I have been eating here for over 10 years and it is consistently 5 stars every time.

The grotto is not a good restaurant for downtown; it is easily one of the very best restaurants in all of Las Vegas.  They blow away most restaurants that are more than double the price. Get your Italian on and eat at this restaurant, you won't be disappointed.
This place has some if the best Italian food I've ever had. Our waitress was terrific, the drinks were delicious, the food was phenomenal, and the view isn't so bad either!

Literally every restaurant my boyfriend and I tried to go to had a ridiculously long wait, but what do you expect in Las Vegas? We walked around and decided to eat at the Golden Nugget because that is what we were closest to. The Golden Nugget has a 9 different restaurants inside and Grotto happens to be among them. 
My boyfriend and I were sat immediately. Our waiter was very punctual. He got our drinks quickly. He gave us enough time to look over the menu. We received fresh bread with an olive oil blend, which I loved. 
My boyfriend ordered their 4th of July drink special. It was a margarita that was red, white, and blue. It was $7.99; there was quite a bit of alcohol in it, and the price wasn't bad. For our entrees, my boyfriend ordered the Meatzza and I ordered the cannelloni. The cannelloni looks somewhat like a pasta burrito. They use a homemade pasta shell that's flat like a tortilla but fluffier and airier, then the pasta shell is rolled with chicken and spinach in it with bechamel (white sauce) and marinara (red sauce) on top. The Meatzza is their signature pizza that is topped with pepperoni, homemade meatballs, Italian sausage, and pancetta. It was good, but I thought my cannelloni was better. :) 
Our server was probably one of the best servers we have had. He was on top of it and his accent made us feel like we were in Italy. We just wish we could remember his name so everyone on Yelp could ask for him if given the chance to eat here.

Had a wedding reception for a party of 20. The food tasted great, the service was wonderful and all of the food arrived to our table at the same time and all warm, which is difficult to do with a party that large. The manager was great and even comped us a huge piece of wedding cake. All of our guests enjoyed themselves and had a wonderful time.

Grotto is an excellent Italian restaurant kinda tucked away deep inside the Golden Nugget. I've passed it so many times on my way in, out, to the pool, to the check-in counter, through the casino - wherever. But I had never stopped in before during my six years of downtown tripping. 

And I seriously regret that now. 

Came in on a Thursday evening by myself, having just wrapped up a conference. Seeing no one in line, I first asked the hostess for a menu so I could spot something I liked. She happily obliged. Everything looked good to me, so I went in and sat down at the bar area, which is large and wraps all around a huge brick oven. I was pretty much the only one there, since it was so early (like around 6 pm). 

A kind gentleman came out and provided a menu and a water. I looked it over and decided I was hungry enough to do an appetizer and a whole pizza. I asked if he had a favorite appetizer. He immediately pointed to the Three Cheese Ravioli, so I ordered it. I also ordered the Herb Chicken Pizza. 

But first, let's not forget that ravioli. It was amazing. I mean really good. And really filling, too. I could have (and should have) made a meal off that dish alone. It was deep fried, covered in some outstanding spices, and the cheese inside was very tasty. I'd order two next time, eat both, then go buy some new pants.

And I just recently started asking servers for recommendations prior to ordering. And so far, I've been impressed everywhere I've done this. So I think I'll continue that trend in the future. 

Now back to the meal. The Herb Chicken Pizza was not bad, just a little runny. I think it may have needed a couple more minutes in that authentic brick oven I sat across at the bar. Oh speaking of which, if you're going to sit at the bar, that's the best place to sit. I got to witness a myriad of interesting-looking (and attractive) pizzas coming out of that thing. 

Based on the parade of pizzas, I think I'd go with the pepperoni next time. I noticed a lot of those coming out and they looked pretty good. 

Customer service here is outstanding. I'm about as low-maintenance as they come, but I noticed my server constantly looking out for me. Kept the water glass full, cleaned the dirty dishes up quickly, and so on. 

And he took it one step further when I went to pay. I had a $50 food & beverage credit from the Golden Nugget and wanted to use it when I paid. But for some reason, it didn't open up when I checked into the hotel a couple days earlier. So my server got on the phone, called two different people, and in about five minutes got it all cleared up. I think that was above and beyond. 

And so was his tip!

So I really do regret not coming here earlier but plan to make it a regular stop on all future visits.

If you like Italian, I know you'll enjoy the food and atmosphere, too.

Best authentic Italian food in California! We had the Lasagna Il Forno & the Cannelloni, both of which were delicious beyond words! My husband has never been a fan of Italian food, but after eating the lasagna here, he's found his new favorite of all time. The prices are modest when you consider the quality of the food here is on par with any high end Italian restaurant you'd find in major cities like NYC or Chicago or even anywhere in Italy. I highly recommend Grotto to anybody who appreciates truly delicious food.

We dined at Grotto last Sunday for lunch and, like our last visit, it did not disappoint.  

We had the Lobster Bisque and Spaghetti & Meatballs.
Both were good.  

The grilled Chicken and Marinara sandwich is also delicious too. Try it if you come here. You won't regret it. 

They also have good salads. 

Another excellent visit.

Was staying at the Golden nugget and this restatement looked very appealing. The happy hour is what stood out. Was one of the only places in the casino with a good HH. We had the calamari for an appetizer and that was delish! We also tried their homemade pizzas and a pasta dish. Both were so yummy and we really liked that they make the pizza in front of you at the bar area. For our Drinks we had beers and bellini's....which I luv well made bellini's. They were tasty! Overall we were satisfied with decor, staff, and food! Highly recommend if staying at the GN!

We arrived hungry at 4:30pm on Saturday.  It looked like there were plenty of tables, but we learned they were all reserved, but we were invited to sit in the bar. The four of us " bellied up to the bar" with Jose as our server/bar tender and had a lovely evening.  

We ordered:  orecchiette Gorgonzola, bruschetta Spaghetti, meatzza pizza, and spaghetti Bologna's and an antipasti appetizer.  Every dish was very good.  

We'll definitely return.  Jose was so friendly and personable.

Worst dining experience of my life. Went here for dinner after my sister's wedding at golden nugget. Service was absolutely terrible and food was very basic and bland. Charged a separate fee on top of 18 % mandatory gratuity. Very disappointed on what should have been a special meal with my family. Save yourself the agony and go somewhere else!

Excellent Italian!
Stopped in for dinner on a Las Vegas weeknight & got a seat immediately in the bar area. My husband says his veal marsala may be the best hes had. Sauce was sweet & cooked perfectly. I had the chicken parm which was thin & still juicy, covered in the right amount of cheese. Nothing was overly or under portioned & food came out quickly. 
Service was fast & friendly and several people stopped to make sure we were satisfied & our glasses were filled. 

Side Note: my husband left his credit card with the bill when we left. Our server turned it in to security & we were able to retrieve it. We are so thankful for the honesty of our server as that situation could have turned out much differently

The Grotto is a fabulous restaurant in the heart of the Golden Nugget on Freemont Ave.  My sister and I have celiac disease and we found the staff to be very knowledgeable and courteous about our questions.  I had shrimp risotto which was incredibly delicious, but the gem of meal was the spinach that came with the chicken my sister ordered was the best thing we had on the trip.

Always go here for happy hour where pizzas are $8 ( basically half price) 
They are huge and I had a hard time eating the while thing nut did. Usually I share with my wife but she wasn't on this trip. The Grotto has numerous interesting combinations to choose from all made in a supper thin crust cooked to perfection. You won't be disappointed.

This is the first place we went to when we checked into the Golden Nugget.  The bartender was funny and also from Jersey like me.  The martini I ordered was cold and made perfectly to order.  We ordered a couple appetizers to eat and the food came out quickly and was very tasty.  The bar is located right next to the pool in the casino which is a great place for people watching.  I gotta say the drinks and apps were good, but the sarcastic wit and personality of the bartender is what made this such a memorable spot.
I had the chicken parmesan with angel hair pasta.... overall it was not bad. Service got a little loss for a bit but not a big deal. Pepperoni pizza was ok. Not the greatest with little to no crust.

I was a bit concerned about the quality of a restaurant in the downtown Vegas hotel, but Grotto has given me new confidence.  We were received by a friendly hostess and seated a nice table overlooking the pool area (night-time).  Mark our waiter was very friendly, funny, and helpful.  He answered any questions about the menu and was particularly helpful with the wine list, noting several affordable options available from a recent event, not on the list.  Service was great throughout the meal and the food was very good.  We mostly had pasta dishes, which were all delicious.
I'd definitely recommend it and will go back next time I'm staying downtown.
Food was great but service was even better! Jason took great care of us, helped us with our selection and was tentative. We got an alfredo dish not on the menu and it was amazing.

If the service wasn't TERRIBLE, Grotto would have gotten 4 stars because the food was delicious, but I am holding a grudge because of the service.

Located in the Golden Nugget on Fremont Street in DTLV, it is an upper-scale Italian restaurant.  I got the chicken parm, which was disproportionate with the pasta to chicken ratio...you'll be able to see in the attached picture.  There is legit one scoop of pasta and a chicken the size of my head.  It was still v good despite this.  Also got the calamari and lobster bisque for appetizers, also tasty. 

But now for the airing of grievances: 

I had to probably wait 20 minutes after the rest of my party's food came with no apology from the wait staff for my meal. The service all around sucked, if I'm being frank. Our water glasses were always empty.  The waitress forgot to bring out the lobster bisque soup, so we got it after dinner was served - isn't soup the appetizer (???!!!)  Took forever for our cocktails and not once did they check up on us.  It was a Friday night, so I would give them the benefit of the doubt if it was busy, but it wasn't...we were a party of 6 and ordered over $300 worth of food and beverages and got the worst service ever.  We will not be back here and I would advise you to chose a different place if you are in the area visiting.

What I like most about this place is the location overlooking the pool which makes for a nice glimpse of outside and hotties in bikinis.  I don't eat downtown that often but I do like that this place is clean, attentive service, and quiet enough for a nice lunch with friends or work reasons should you find yourself downtown.  This isn't the best italian food in town but it's what I consider one of the nicer places downtown and open for lunch which is rare.
Not good... Bad service, the food is not gpod, my pasta was so sweet... Anyways I vote that this restaurant gets into kitchen nightmare series by Gordon Ramsey!!!! Enough said, skip this place

Fabulous dinner!  Had the roasted tomato soup, probably the best I've ever had!  Entre was a superb  grilled mahi. 

Highly recommended!

The food was good, the service was horrendous. Our waitress Carroll  literally kept forgetting about us. Took forever to even come to our table to take our drink order. By time she arrived we knew what we wanted to eat. We asked for a drink  menu, yet another long wait. Ordered our drinks. Another long weight. Asked us if we wanted dessert twice. I'm literally writing this as I wait for our check, it's that bad.

The second time we have dined here.....and each time the service was superior and the food outstanding! The veal was very good, the Chianti recommendation was on target, and for being in the middle of a casino...the atmosphere is great!

Pretty standard, over priced, casino restaurant. I had Linguine Pescatore which was really good, but it definitely did not justify the $27 price tag. In fact, I have prepared something very similar before with a mixed seafood bag from Trader Joe's for $9.99 (which fed 2 people). The service was fine -- nothing memorable, but also nothing to complain about.  This is probably a restaurant to visit if staying at the casino, but even as a local I would not go out of my way to eat here again.

Found a gem tonight. Since we were staying at the Golden Nugget, my wife suggested going here for dinner, and, after reviewing Yelp food photos, we decided on Grotto as much to avoid going outside in the heat as to appease the appetite the pictures generated. 
First if all, consistently throughout our dining experience, Jeninne, our service specialist, took very good care of our table of four. She kept our glasses filled without being intrusive. Our order was correct and delivered correctly to each party member. We had the Calamari appetizer which was tender, lightly breaded and lightly crispy. Not only delicious but plenty for our table. Lobster bisque and Tomato bisque very, very good. Ceasar salads were both completely consumed. Our table made a custom entree request for Chicken Fettuccine Alfredo, not on the menu. This was received by the staff as "Of course! No problem!" and the dish was reported to be very tasty. Also ordered was the Mahi, Piscatore and Spaghetti and Meatballs. We were offered a second basket of bread without asking. The only small criticisms were some dishes needed salt added and there was no Cannoli on the dessert menu. We took dessert back to our room for later as the meal was so tasty. The total tab ran about $50 per person but you could easily spend less here and be well satisfied for dinner.

Had an excellent meal with veal parmesan and rotisserie chicken. The service was very prompt. And our server Taya was superb she has worked there for over 11 years and really knew how to take care of her again. I must recommend the bruschetta as it was outstanding. The restaurant itself is a bit noisy and not real romantic but certainly worth the price. Wine selection is adequate and not overpriced as well. Would recommend this restaurant

i was contacted by the business after filling out their own, internal feedback survey.  i had a very nice conversation with a manager who was apologetic, and agreed that my order of arancini (apparently he was working at the time of my meal) was not up to par, and the error had been addressed with the kitchen staff.  however- i was offered nothing more than a "handshake" should i return to vegas.  once again- this restaurant does not live up to general expectation.  i'm not impressed with the customer service at this establishment.

Came here on the way back to our room for a quick bite after a long day of gambling. I must say, better than I expected. Our bartender (Jeff) was just all around outstanding. The drinks he made from the specialty menu were perfect! The mango martini is a must! He was always very personable and attentive. The food was great too. The spinach dip was one of the best I've tried and the Meatzza was very flavorful. Although I won't be staying at the Nugget again, I will be stopping by the Grotto for the drinks at the very least!

We came to the Golden Nugget to see a show. We got here early so we felt we had time to eat in one of their nicer restaurants. We had not tried the Grotto for a long time. There was no wait and we were able to get a table close to the window overlooking the pool and the shark tank. On the positive side, the service was outstanding. Our waiter came to our table within minutes of sitting down, explaining the daily special and taking our drink orders. The busboy brought the bread almost immediately. It was delicious. It came with olive oil. He also brought a flavored butter that was excellent. I was disappointed that the restaurant only had two beers on tap. However I was able to order their Sin City Amber. It was excellent. We started with their Italian chopped salad. It was just ok. We had it with their bleu cheese dressing. The bleu cheese dressing was just tasteless. For the main course, we had the chicken cacciatore. This was also fairly devoid of flavor. There was a small amount of vegetables that came with it. Again, almost without flavor. Overall, five star service brought down to a three star rating because of the quality of the food. I don't think I will be back. There are too many other good dining  choices in the downtown area, even within the Golden Nugget.
WOW.....Best Italian we have ever had!!  I had the Crusted Sea Bass.  No words to describe the flavor...soooo good!  I only wish I had ordered Two orders so that I could have had some to take home!!

I asked my bartender what is good  tonight ? He said Mussels. I ordered mussels  very very bad . Old and hard . Very old old big chewy mussels. 
Do not listen the bartenders. Thin Pizza is good
Very bad mussels growth 
Sunday jun 10

In short, the Grotto was about as close as you can get to fine dining near Fremont street.  My wife and I split the Mahi and Lobster Bisque.  Both were fantastic.  

I asked if there would be a plate sharing charge, the waiter says, no, we just require a smile.  They split the bisque into two smaller bowls and they did the same for the dinner.  

Everything tasted great and the service was as expected.

They brought out the dessert cart, which included chocolate cake, a cheese cake, a 7 layer strawberry wedding cake and espresso with biscotti.  We had to pass because we were full.  Next time we will get you, dessert cart.  Next time.

Kim, our server was great. Drinks stayed full and she was atentive without hovering. The restaurant was busy but not overly so and we were seated without a reservation right away. We sarted with calamari which tasted very fresh, but could have ised more seasoning, i added tobasco to mine and it was great  then we had veal scallopini which was really good but I would have preferred a tomato based sauce. To finish up we had coconut cream pie.

The $8 pizza during happy hour is great.  The drinks are good.  The wait staff friendly.  Didn't like the bar tables or stools.  Very flimsy and so tightly packed, it was hard to seat yourself.  The small tables barely held 2 pizzas and 2 drinks.  No walls so the loud casino and pool noise traffic is all you hear.
What a great surprise. Needed to get a quick meal after hours of poker. Really good Italian food. Service was quick and the food was really good. Romano crusted chicken and pasta was outstanding.

This was the best dinner (and cheapest) we had while in Vegas. The server was friendly and checked on us frequently. My husband and I split a Margherita pizza and the Rigatoni Salsiccia. Both were delicious. The pizza was the best I've had in a  long time. Also split the chocolate cake which was so good.

Decent Italian American food but nothing really authentic or memorable.  Pasta was kind of bland but I'm very biased since I travel to Italy on a fairly regular basis.  The bar staff didn't seem too enthusiastic but then again I think one of them was from New Jersey and people from there usually strike me as odd and/or irritating.   Oddly the power went out during dinner and the smell of smoke from the pizza ovens started to stink up the bar.  Would skip this restaurant and check out the steak restaurant at Gold Nugget instead.  I heard really good things about that place.

Golden Nugget is still awesome and getting better but the Grotto is weak at best. The pizzas are mediocre for the price. The sausage and peppers was especially sub par. Almost just a cheese pizza with tiny amounts of sausage and hardly any peppers. Will stay at the Nugget again because I love it but will not eat at the Grotto again.
We loved the glass room that overlooked the pool.  The meatballs were fantastic 5/5.  The Fettuccine Alfredo lacked flavor and was very bland 1/5.  The Penne Arrabiatta 4/5.  Service was excellent.
Friendly service, all of the Italian favorites. Great bread basket and dipping oil!

We had a wonderful experience sharing in food and cocktails with family an friends who attended our Vegas wedding. The Grotto staff accommodated out party very well, stored our cake on site for us and the wait staff was great. The management continually checked to ensure all was well. Not to mention the food was great. If looking for a place in downtown Vegas, check it out for comparatively reasonable Italian fare. If with a small group or couple, grab a seat by the pool viewing window.

I am not even comfortable giving this restaurant one star! The most horrible service I've ever had! Food came out late and our breakfast potatoes were cold. Server never came back to check on us until it was time to bring the bill. When she took our order, she completely forgot about one of the people in our party. It wasn't that busy either! She spilled coffee on the table and in the water glass. Did she bring back fresh water? Of course not! Over priced, horrible food, AND bad service. Will definitely not be going back.

Saw that they had chicken parmesan for $10 and decided to stop in.  It came with a nice portion of spaghetti in tomato sauce and the chicken parm was perfectly seasoned and cooked.  It was a decent portion as well and it definitely filled me up.  They have medium pizzas for $8 during happy hour and other food and drink items to choose from.  Service at the bar was great.  I would come back for it if I'm ever in the area.  3.5 stars
Food was okay not super impressed, but service and atmosphere was great just wish it was more authentic for the prices. Would not come here again.

We ended up here after attempting to get a seat at Andiamos at the D. Unfortunately they were booked solid for the night. Still wanting Italian, we took a quick walk down to The Golden Nugget and quickly got a seat at the bar at Grotto. The atmosphere was pretty cool at the bar since you got to watch them make their pizzas. I had the seared mozzarella appetizer which was delicious (especially the tomato sauce it was in.) The veal scaloppini in the main dish was very good as well. The highlight of the meal was the strawberry dessert. This was about two weeks ago and I can't remember the name of the dessert, but just get it. It was delicious. I tried to replicate it as soon as I got home and it wasn't close. Ask your server, they will know what it is. It's almost cake, cream, strawberries, and magic I think. The only complaint was that the service was a little slow. But I suppose that is to be expected on a Friday night at a bar seat.
Amazing Happy Hour!  Margherita Pizza is delicious - service is impeccable and the manager never sits still - always making sure the guests are well taken care of.  Lemon Drop martinis....YUM!

For lunch or dinner the Chicken Marsala is absolutely incredible. Always excellent service and the manager checks on you each and every time. 
Yummy!!

I've dined here a couple of times for lunch. It's alright. Nothing ever stands out. And I never leave feeling like I just had a great meal. But it's good enough to actually eat it. So yeah...it's a-ok. The ambiance is more of a lower end casino cafe. The service is generally nice, but not exactly pleasant or attentive. Eh, it's all just fine.

While in town for a mother/daughter weekend, my 21 year old and her friend were really excited to have dinner at Grotto, in the Golden Nugget hotel.  They had found it online and were very much looking forward to eating at a restaurant with an aquarium.  Upon arrival, they were so disappointed to find that the restaurant had just a distant view of a very small aquarium in the pool area.  It was nothing like they had expected.  For our meal, we ordered 2 Grotto salads to start (very basic chopped lettuce & tomatoes with a vinaigrette), a margherita pizza (just ok), a bowl of soup (very bland), a chopped salad with chicken & the half rotisserie chicken with roasted potatoes & sauteed spinach (the chicken was very dry and I only ended up eating a few bites of it).  We declined dessert, though those looked really good.  All in all, the meal was very mediocre and we woud not eat there again.

While staying at the Golden Nugget and consuming all of the gluttonous food and beverage that Fremont Street has to offer, my friend and I decided we needed a nice big salad for lunch.  The restaurant is right next to the beautiful pool and the awesome shark tank & water slide.  We were lucky enough to sit by the window and it felt like we were sitting on a patio on a perfect sunny day (which it was, but we were inside).

I decided on the Italian chopped salad and was very happy.  The salad was great and I couldn't believe I ate the entire mound of chopped delicious ingredients.  I did get the dressing on the side, so I'm not sure how much they would usually put on the salad. 

We brought the boys back for the end of happy hour so we could check out the pizzas on special for $6 (happy hour is from 2-6). They were a great size for the price, thin crackery crust, and delicious toppings.  The drink prices were not great on happy hour, but I've learned that is pretty consistent for The Golden Nugget.  Then again, it would make sense seeing as how it is a step up from the rest of the hotels on Fremont. 

The server for lunch was very nice, however the bartenders for happy hour seemed a little less than happy. I know it can get crazy in a small bar area with everyone wanting to order, but when your working for tips a small smile every now an again won't hurt. I promise your face won't crack!

Overall, I'm a fan of Grotto and will go back for delicious food anytime I'm on Fremont.
Probably top 5 Italian places I've had in Vegas. It's a must try.  they have the best sauce I've ever had

I got married in Vegas in April and I planned my entire wedding online via email and phone call - I worked with Jennifer - the Sales Manager there. She answered all my questions - and was very clear about how much things would cost. We reserved an area of the restaurant that is near the pool that is their Atrium. Although we had to "buy out" the space - it was worth the money. 

On the day of the dinner, the service was amazing! We had a pretty large party consisting of 40 people - the waiters were on top of refills and getting the food to everyone at the same time. My guests also really loved the food (I did too)!

We paid extra to have a wedding cake and did it through the Golden Nugget's bakery. It was so delicious! We ordered the carrot cake and honestly it is one of the best carrot cakes I have ever tried. 

The Sales Manager Jennifer was amazing! She even offered to meet me in person the day before so that if I had any more questions I could ask her in person and so that my husband and I can see what the Atrium looked like the day before. 

As a side note - they also allowed us to bring out own centerpieces so it could feel more like a real wedding reception! 

I really appreciated how accommodating the Grotto was to my needs for my special day! I highly recommend this place for a wedding dinner or large party because of the amazing service and delicious food.

After a long day (and short night before) of Vegas, we stopped in this place before heading up to our room.  It was late, so we weren't looking for a huge meal.  I settled for Tomato Bisque, a side of spinach sauteed in olive oil and garlic, and the Mrs. had a salad.  They brought warm bread with the meal.  

For a little bit of money, we received quality service and great tasting food.  How good was the spinach?  The table next to ours asked what it was and ordered it with their pizza.  Spinach Wins!

Had a great meal with a large group of friends. Good was fantastic and our server Jose was awesome. We hung out and had drinks waiting for everyone to show up. Meatballs were yummy and the lasagna with meat sauce was fantastic.
Great happy hour! The mussels were delicious and loved the thin crust pizza!!  Definitely recommend!!!

First of all, props to the staff. Even though it was a busy weekend evening, we still got fast, attentive, and friendly service. Secondly, the food tasted sooo good. Their lobster bisque is by far the best I've ever had. The mussels were super tasty as well. Other dishes we tried were the spaghetti bolognese, chicken marsala and ravioli, all scrumptious. The decor made for good conversation as well,  and by decor I mean the murals featuring European characters performing public sex acts while enjoying their meals. haha. Good times at the Grotto.

My food was good, but my fiance's dinner was a different story. He ordered a simple dish of spaghetti and meatballs. He found a hair in the spaghetti, removed it and found multiple short, black hairs throughout the dish. It gave a new meaning to angel hair pasta   The waitress and manager were very apologetic and did the most they could to make things right. I do recommend they have a good tiramisu.

Had dinner here with my wife, cousin and his wife. We are big foodies when it comes to Vegas. I'm happy to say that we did not go wrong when deciding on this restaurant. Everything was fantastic from the stuffed mushrooms (to die for), to their shrimp cocktail. Everything that we ordered that night was full of satisfying flavor. Very happy, can't wait to come again. Don't forget to try the mojitos!

This is our go to restaurant downtown!  Tucked inside the Golden Nugget, with a view of the pool.  The food is always on point.  Service in the dining room, at the bar or on the pool patio is always first class.  You can't go wrong!

I could not include pictures of the food, because it was so good we ate it that fast! The chicken marsala was done to perfection, and the sausage rigatoni was incredible as well. The Cabernet I got was a perfect complement, tasted just delicious. Arturo was a great waiter with a nice smile. I absolutely would recommend this restaurant to  a couple,crowd or even a family.

This dining experience was absolutely atrocious due to the service and ambiance.  Definitely not a destination dining spot.  If your next stop after Grotto is within walking distance, fine, but it's certainly not worth getting in a cab and driving downtown from the LV strip. 

It literally took 35 minutes to receive our fried calamari appetizer unfortunately, it wasn't worth the wait since the dish was  overcooked (rubbery) and extremely salty. 

For my entree, I ordered the Veal Kickerillo. The menu description read: Parmesan-crusted scaloppine with mushrooms & a touch of lemon served with fettuccine Alfredo. What I received was 4 small and paper thin medallions all the exact same size with 1 slice of a mushroom on top. I honestly believe there was more breading than veal. 

The highlight of the evening was when a homeless women approached our table for money. Right in the middle of the dining room.

I don't know where to begin from service to food everything was amazing. I had a friend come to town for her daughter spring break. First she had few expectations but let her have fun and take memories back to new jersey to share with her friends. My friend was pregnant and had a taste for everything but I digress. 


We checked out the steak house menu first,  we checked the BBQ restaurant next then landed in front of grotto menu. This is all after having explained and offered all to ms. Pregnant to FINALLY have her pick grotto because she finally had so many options sound she couldn't pick one.  
I had the lobster bisque and canoloni (sp) almost like a soft shell taco rolled up sided with chicken and spinach.  I could lick both plate and bowl.  Friends daughter had the tortellini with pesto sauce we ....yes we all tried one another meal lol. Then my girlfriend had a house salad that had fresh made dressing to die for and some chicken dish, I forget the name,  that had capers and angel hair pasta that all melted in your mouth. 

Lastly,  I tried the orange creme brulee for dessert.  It wasn't the best creme brulee I've had but it was delicious.  

Well definitely be going back.  Great find in what would seem the last likely place. I always tell visitors that residents rarely venture to the strip regularly but for Grotto my spouse and I will a little more often,  with or without visitors in town.

Staying at the Nugget, so this was a choice of convenience.  Ordered Sea Bass as a recommendation by the waiter.  It was smothered in a dark mushroomy sauce, that seemed to be more suited for a steak....not a white fish.  Didn't like it.  Husband ordered eggplant parmaesan and it was good.  My friend ordered a saffron risotto, and I made her send it back as it tasted like an old dish rag.  They made a big fuss about our complaint and two different people came over to the table to discuss why we didn't like the risotto.  They insulted us by insinuating that we didn't know that saffron has a different taste, whatever......it was still bad. When we received the bill it was taken off, all $4.99 of it. You would have thought it was a big ticket item the way the restaurant was reacting to our complaint. 
        We did enjoy the beer that was micro brewed there, I believe it was called Sin City. 
        After gazing around the room, I think the hot item in the restaurant was pizza, ah hindsight.

The food here is so amazing. Everything we tried was incredible. We were there on a Saturday night and the service was not bad at all. My only complaint was that it's loud, but as it's in the open there isn't much to do about that.

Some of the best calamari I've had!  The remainder of the menu is limited and average.  Service is average.  Wine list and server wine knowledge is average.  If you're in the Nugget you'll get much more bang out of Vic & Anthony's!!  Maybe stop into The Grotto to watch the pool crowd, have an calamari app, and glass of wine before dinner at Vic & Anthony's; that would be a perfect evening!
Love the Grotto salad with extra tomatos.Friend had the penne and liked it. Lunch The Grotto salad is $8.

I had an absolute blast with Denise! she's my favorite waitress ever and she was the highlight of my trip! the bread and peach Bellini's are amazing!! I ate so much that I couldn't even make a dent in my pizza which was also incredible. 10/10 would recommend.

We went here christmas eve before seeing Gordy Brown.  Honestly our expectations were quite low and Grotto blew them away.  I was in a group of 4 and we decided to do family style and get a pizza that was great and chopped salad for an app and then two entrees--chicken parm which I get at almost every italian place and it was excellent and we got the garlic shrimp that was just fair.  Our service was great and the creme br√ªl√©e dessert was amazing!

First of all our server, Kim did a wonderful job. I had the chicken marsala. It was a little light on the sauce for my taste but Kim quickly brought me extra. It was so good I ate every bite on the plate. Everyone in my party thoroughly enjoyed the meal. The bread was delicious and all the food was very fresh.

Service was good, fast. Food was adequate for the price.  We we hoping for something more as far as authentic Italian flavors- nothing was bad but nothing was really good either. Cigarette smoke floated in from the casino making the atmosphere less pleasant.

Grotto ristorante was one of those carefree yet elegant dinner spots.  My husband and I went there a date night dinner and the experience was awesome!  The service was amazing!  Unfortunately I forgot the name of our waiter but he was excellent!  I had the the chicken Romano and that was very well made!  My husband had their signature veal dish and he devoured it!  Wonderful meal and great price!

Went to this place last night with some friends and I really enjoyed it.  Loved the style of the place and the ambiance.  The staff was very friendly.  The food was really good, we ordered the Calamari Toto, Morty Pizza,Lasagne Al Forno, and the Rigatoni con Salsiccia.  Everything tasted great and the sauces were amazing and tasted as if they were made from scratch.  I would recommend this place to family and friends and think it would also be a great place to bring someone for a date.  I will be coming back.

Ben here at least a dozen times. Food generally very good. Pizza, pasta, chicken, even breakfast Joe's Scramble, all very good.

Ate corned beef and hash this morning. Now I know why it's called corned beef AND hash.

Recipe: start with mirepoix, add green and red bell peppers, and potatoes. Then add 2 tablespoons of tabasco (really). Add cubed corned beef (good), drop two poached eggs on top.
This dish not recommended.
Service was good; however, food was average. The calamari were ok. The pizza was ok but the lobster soup literally sucked....watery and bland. Next time will be better maybe
Super great wait staff and delicious food. Also great drink specials during happy hour. One of the best meals I had while in Vegas hands down.

Had dinner here with a group of 5.  I had the lobster bisque and it was the best one I had on the trip.

The cobb salad was very good.

Service was excellent.

Didn't have reservations, but not a problem.  Was seated after about a 5 minute wait on a Thursday night at 6pm.  Sat by the pool side with the shark tank in view.  Ordered the chicken parmesan and the veal parmesan.  Both came with a small side order of spaghetti.  Plenty of meat.  The strawberry angel food cake dessert was a 10+!  The slice was big enough for 2 to share and was only $8.  Would definitely recommend and would return on the next trip to Vegas!

I've never had a bad meal here. Sure, it's a bit pricey, but it's some of the best Italian food I've had.
Love the thin crust pizza. Lasagna is the best I've found. 

Extensive wine list. A plus in my book.
