Wine? Yes. Food? No. Stay away from the lobster bisque...too fishy.

The meatballs are exceptional,  and the pizza with pear and gorgonzola was so delicious.  Was with a large party and the service was great.  Spaghetti sauce is slightly sweet,  so if that's not your bag,  consider requesting an arrabiata sauce.  Dessert is worth it, the chocolate cake is fantastic,  as is the wedding cake and tiramisu. It's pricey so come prepared.
Fabulous food and great service by Denise!!  A very nice place for a girls night out dinner!

This place was great! We got there on a Saturday around 6pm and sat right away! I drank a Pamamada cocktail. It was good, but tasted like straight Limoncello. We both shared a 14 inch pizza that came out in about 10 minutes! It was a cheap and delicious meal. Best meal for your buck in the Fremont District in Vegas!

Even though I spent 5 nights at the Golden Nugget during my recent vacation to Vegas, I didn't get around to trying Grotto until my last day there. And in retrospect, that's a shame, because Grotto was definitely the best restaurant I tried at the Golden Nugget. Grotto has a bit of a Olive Garden feel to it, but with slightly better food. And since I am a fan of Olive Garden, consider that a compliment.

But unlike Olive Garden, they do cater to the Vegas casino crowd by being open early for breakfast. This was first meal of the day at Grotto ... stumbling back into the Golden Nugget after a marathon session of brews and Sigma Derby at The D. Looking for something sweet and decadent, I ordered the cheese blintzes. I received four delicious, ample-sized blintzes with a side of fruit compote. I was happy and headed to my room for three hours of sleep before checkout.

My flight out of town wasn't until late that night, so after check out, I hung around Golden Nugget. After getting some additional rest and nursing my hangover poolside, I decided I needed some carby comfort food. So I went for round two at Grotto and settled on their Chicken Fettuccine Alfredo. It came with an ample portion of salad and bread - both good. The menu advertised homemade fettuccine, and the noodles were pretty darn good. The chicken was cooked nicely and tasty. The Alfredo sauce was a bit on the thin side for my taste, and could use a bit more cheese flavor, but it was still enjoyable. At $15, this was a pretty good deal for lunch from a casino.

The dining at Golden Nugget tends to shade towards pricy and upscale - what else would you expect from the parent company of Morton's? And the dining at DTLV tends to be either high-end or divey. Grotto is one of the few "in-between" options - they offer a reasonably-priced sit-down meal that is both tasty and a good value for your food dollar.. If you are looking something between the spectrum of fine dining and Fried Twinkies, Grotto is worth a try.
One of my favorite Italian Restaurants of all! The Wedding Soup is to die for and the Chicken Cannelloni is superb! However everything on the menu is delicious!

If you are looking for a Goidelic and reasonable lunch then head here. It's located in the golden nugget. We had salad and meatballs the first time and a pizza the second. Great view of the pool area.  Good solid food

Great place to chow down. The Margherita Pizza I ordered was delicious with fresh ingredients. My dessert which was the Tiramisu ranks high above rest, It's very tasty. Service was respectful and pleasant. Enjoy! 
Must Try

I was quite surprised at how good this place is.    I had the lobster bisque which was one of the best I have ever had.   Our friends had the wedding soup, which they raved about and went back the next day to have again.   I tried their pizza, which was not the best brick oven I have had but very good nonetheless.    Our friends had the Pasta Diavolo and some other fettucine and were both very happy.

I ordered the Chicken Milanese salad. Half the items mentioned as the ingredients were either not there or just barely there. Service was good. Bread served tasted great until the second round when it came to the table partially frozen/ cold. My daughter ordered the ravioli and there was only 5 of them. The place is overpriced and over rated. Not enough on your order to fill a normal person.
Very good food, we really enjoyed ourselves, the drinks were excellent, the wait staff were very nice and the restaurant has quaint ambience.

Located in the Golden Nugget, this small crowded place is clean and their appetizers were good but standard to any bar food that I had.  The waiter initially had an attitude but got friendlier right before he handed us the bill.  But the service as fast.  Maybe I need to come back when it's not March Madness, but I doubt it.
It's a family dinner on the Old Vegas Strip. Not a bad choice for a late nite dinner after walking all night.

There is nowhere else like The Grotto!!!
The food is simply awesome!

Try the meatballs as an appetizer, they are so light and fluffy they are hard to explain.

You can't have a bad meal here

What seemed like a nice little restaurant wasn't quite what i thought it was. ...

We ordered the calimari as an app, it arrived at a decent time but seemed a bit cold.  Still tasty though. 

We ended up ordering 2 pepperoni pizzas and a small salad.   It took over 45 minutes for it to arrive! !  After noticing that groups of 4-6 were already finishing their meals i finally asked when our food would arrive? !?!   It arrived soon after that and the manager stopped by,  He didn't have any idea why it took so long but was nice and friendly and did take our appetizer off. 

 Was nice that the pizza was larger than expected but it didn't set  I'm my husband's stomach ):  

My salad was  just ok, simple vinaigrette but as a bit wilted?   Babe that's why it didn't set well in my tummy either ):

Doubt we will eat here ever again after this experience!

Top notch service, good food, and beautiful atmosphere make this place a WIN at the Golden Nugget! 

Went here for a 'romantic' dinner during happy hour on a Tuesday. The bar tender was the best server we had on the whole trip. He recommended we sit in the bar to take advantage of half price pizzas and $2 off drinks! Thanks, man! It was a completely affordable delicious meal. Their pizzas are wood fired with top shelf ingredients. We also ordered the meatballs, which were garlicky and good, plus the ravioli alla vodka, which tasted fresh and well balanced. Overall, the service put it over the top and we were very happy we happened into the Grotto. 

When our party of 11 decided to go downtown for Christmas Day, my boyfriend and I suggested Grotto to the family for Christmas dinner. We were glad we did! Everyone was impressed! The service was amazing, again and the food was well prepared. Everything was on point. The appetizers were priced at $8-$15. Bruschetta was excellent. Fried ravioli was a touch overdone. My favorite dish I tried was the chicken francais. I ordered the chicken marsala accompanied by fresh fettuccine Alfredo, which was good, but not the best I've had. The ciabatta bread was soft and hot and the dipping oil was really well flavored. Desserts looked amazing, but I was stuffed. The favorite of the table was a ricotta cream and strawberry bombe, which was beautiful. 

This was by far the best family meal we had in Vegas and I would recommend Grotto to anyone looking for perfect service and good Italian food!

Just wandered in and so glad we did. Service was outstanding - kudos to Angela as she was the main reason for this great review. Her recommendations were spot on (get the mahi!) and her sense of humor and attention to detail are 5 star. We'll definitely be back next time we're in town!

Happy Hour Mon-Fri 2-6p, Sun-Thur 10:30p-12a

Happy hour specials are $4-6 drinks and $8 pizzas.  $4 Grotto's Famous Peach Bellini was perfect.  Best bellini I've had.  The cocktails were just as good.  They have lots of fruity martinis which is my thing.  They put a bar munchies menu out at HH that seems to be regular pricing.  Portions are huge.  We were expecting smaller plates but they were full size (goes with pricing).  From the bar munchies menu we ordered Bruschetta, Bacon Mac & Cheese Bites, Spicy Chicken Sliders and Gorgonzola Fries.  Food was good but a little overpriced.  I would prefer smaller portions for HH.  It wasn't too busy on a weekday afternoon.  Our bartender was friendly and kept the drinks coming.  Works for me.

Went here with my friend for dinner Saturday night. Carla was our sever , she was a 10 out of a 10. Her menu knowledge was awesome and she was honest with her recommendations. The veal my friend got was amazing he said and I had the chicken. Parm which is my fav all time and it was one of the best.. We sat on the patio which was awesome.  Nice wine list. But the lasting impression was Carla, I loved her and will go back just for her to serve us again. Thanks for a great night!

Service was slow despite the restaurant being empty. Food was actually good. Everyone in my party enjoyed their meal. The problem is that I had the Italian meat panini and got horrible food poisoning from it. Finally feeling better after 24 hours of hell. Will probably never return after this experience.
Good food, lobster bisque is top notch, good wine and a nice quiet atmosphere.

Came in for lunch today because honestly we were too hungover to venture out of the hotel. The food portions were quite large. But the service was TERRIBLE. And it wasn't a busy time either. We saw our server three times total. To order our food, bringing us our food, and then the checks. Which even after asking for the check we waited ten minutes to get that. The food was mediocre. At least the spaghetti and meatballs were. My friends panini was delicious though. Our waters were always empty. Only got one refill (when he brought our food). If the service wasn't so bad the whole situation may have been different. Wouldn't go back again.

Dinner with a business party, so there were about 30 of us lined up against the north wall (I think it was north...).  The appetizers were very nice - calamari and bruchetta.  The main course of fried shrimp as tasty, and desserts of chocolate cake and strawberry shortcake were over the top.  Received terrific service and would highly recommend if you love Italian.

The food was quite excellent. We go to a number of great Italian restaurants and this one would rank near the top. I did not give them a 5 star only because the service from our waitress was just so so. She never asked us if we liked our food and was just basically absent during our dinner. At a nice restaurant like this one would expect more.

The food is awsome the meatballs are world class the chicken franchasise was amazing the bread is true Italian nice soft middle with a crust every thing about the food is amazing the service a little  slow  servers have to many tables and they a game with seating they leave open tables so that as guest walk by you think there not on a wait  then they make u make 15 20.minutes which ever one waits because you can't walk anywhere else
Not impressed, my dinner was bland, the mahi was over cooked, shrimp were good, I would pass on this place, cute if the shark tank was the only redeemable quality to dinner
Fantastic food. Had the cheese ravioli and it was awesome. Didn't get a chance to take a peek at the wine list, but I'm assuming it's just as impressive as the food.

This is my family, especially my fathers, favorite place to eat .. Not just in the Golden Nugget, but in all of the downtown area .. Great pizza, pasta, salads & soup .. Gotta sit in the bar area .. Hopefully Jeff Kucesa takes care of you .. He's the best!!

The Grotto has solid service, solid food, and an interesting view of a shark aquarium. For all that, it's just one of many restaurants in a casino in downtown Vegas. The one thing that stood out to me was the cappuccino. It was very good...and I can be quite a coffee snob.  :-)
We loved this restaurant. It gives a great view of the pool. Makes me wish I was staying in the Golden Nugget. If I ever decide to stay in old Vegas again, this is THE spot!!!

Came here 3/1/2016 Tuesday night. Had great service. 5 minutes left of happy hour. Got us 2 drinks a piece and a pizza. Love Love Love the Meatzza Pizza. 8 bucks during happy hour. Came again tonight awesome service. So fast got us more drinks and more pizza. Love it! Not good for kids but Great for date night. Rite by the pool, a great location. It's a must try if you are in the Golden Nugget! I will be back!

We had dinner here at Grotto Ristorante 9.17.16.  We didn't have a reservation, but were seated within 5 minutes of walking up to a very busy dining area.  All in all, the meals were average.  Average size, average price, and average in taste.  I had the chicken piccata and my gf had a pizza.  The wait staff and hostess were pleasant.  I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here again, but in a pinch it does the job.

The elevated terrace at the Grotto bar is an excellent spot for Italian food, beer, a glass of wine or to nurse your favorite cocktail. I perch myself at one of the pub tables and watch the people traverse through the hotel/casino/pool area. The GN pool is right across the way for more people watching..such a prime scene! 

..And now for the good.. It's delicious.. I call up the Margherita pizza. Fresh basil, mozzarella, and delicious roma tomatoes. It's the best Margherita pizza in the business.. enough for two hungry people ready to conquer the Vegas scene. For appetizers, you can never go wrong with the crispy calamari..so darn good. 

The bartenders and servers are always helpful and friendly, even when the place is packed! 

Good Italian dishes and a prime viewing spot. Give Grotto a shot.. I'm never disappointed here. I will return on my next stay at the Nugget.

I just spent 5 days in Vegas and I must say this restaurant The Grotto at the Golden Nugget is a hidden Gem we had a caesar salad and the pizza is out of this world it comes from a Wood-Fired oven completely handmade I can honestly say I don't remember in my entire life having a better Pizza

A little odd when there were many open tables but there was a wait. This was because The Grotto takes reservations which is nice.. as long as you can make it. We sat at the bar instead (one of my fav thing to do anyway). Food was pretty good, typical Vegas over priced but its hard to find anything around that compares with a good atmosphere surrounding it.

We wanted a special place to share an anniversary and birthday celebration so opted for this since it was convenient to our hotel. Ambiance was a bit too noisy for good conversation so if you want a quiet place to chat, this is not it.

Food was fine, a few notches above typical Italian and well done. One of us had an order that got mucked up but the waitress handled it beautifully and got the right one to us within about 10 minutes. The major disappointment was that management didn't come out to apologize, and nothing was offered as compensation for making 1 of us wait to eat while everyone else had their food.

I've been to this chain restaurant plenty of items - homecoming, prom, anniversaries- you name it! But this particular location is what I'm reviewing. Staff was on point. Attentive and very nice. The restaurant in the casino can be quite busy at anytime but she handle it very well. They have HH I think from 2pm -6pm - includes $8 pizzas and $5 beers and wine? But I had lunch instead. Had the bolognese pork pasta and it was amazing. Warm and the sauce we perfect.

We were unable to dine here in the evening because there was an hour and a half wait for a table so let that be your guide

We did have pizza during our stay by the hotel pool from Grotto

The pizza was thin like we like it and very good

I was hoping that this place would be good as there are not a lot of Italian places in the downtown area.  We had a large party, 20 people, so we split up into 2 tables.  They accommodated us and that we were thankful for.  I had the rigatoni with mushrooms and cream sauce and it didn't have much taste to it.  The appetizers were good, the bruschetta and stuffed mushrooms.  Others had the spaghetti and meatballs, but shared that there was not much taste to the sauce.   I wish I could report better.

The food was okay and the music was a nice change from the country music playing in the casino.  I had the special (veal parmigiana in this case), decent but soggy.  Don't know for Vegas but I've had better Italian in Seattle.  The house red was tasty though (pino noir blend).  I do agree with R.J's comment about the food being over seasoned.   Seriously, a little rosemary goes a long way

The food's actually pretty good. The service, however, is not.

Water was not refilled for the entire meal. Four water glasses sat empty for literally an hour. Other empty glasses from wine and soft drinks were never picked up. Not even after the bill arrived. The empties just sat there.

Our server was loud and sorta cocky. Which actually can be an asset in some cases. But this guy couldn't pull it off...and, based on our experience with him, he had no justifiable reason to be so self-confident in his style.

Food, though slow to arrive, was pretty good on the whole.

Half of the table enjoyed salads and they were quite flavorful, particularly the mixed greens with beets, pears, and pomegranate dressing. Very nice.

The cannelloni was out of this world good. The portion was only two noodles. I could've eaten a thousand. Fantastic!

The least successful entree at the table was a pizza, which had a droopy, limp crust, sparse toppings and little cheese. If  you go--and that should be a BIG "if" in my estimation--take a pass on the menu's pizza section.

After such good food, I was ready to forgive the lackluster service. But that's when Mr. Cocky Server came back and took our final drink orders: a couple of wines, a coffee, and a refill of Coke. "Got it," he said, "two Merlot, a coffee, and a snort of coke." WHAT? Who says that? I wanted to kick him in the nuts for fucking up a perfectly good meal with friends.

The good food is not worth the awful service in my book. I'd rather go to an Olive Garden. At least the server there wouldn't cap off the evening with narcotics jokes.

Excellent food. So it pains me to give so few stars. But the service is terrible. Staff is very nice but incredibly slow. Waited 15 minutes when we got here before anyone came by. Then waited another 15 to have one (bottled) beer brought to the table. Since finishing our meal, we have now waited a grand total of 39 minutes to pay our bill. It looks like they just don't have enough people on staff because these two girls are hustling, but it appears that they are the only two servers on the floor. Hire on some extra help guys! I don't mind waiting for food (it actually came out fairly quick once we ordered) but to have to wait this long for service is kind of ridiculous, especially during happy hour.

Again, super sad to say this because the food was great, but I definitely would not come back :(

This place is a diamond in the rough (and I use rough jokingly) the Golden Nugget is beautiful and up-to-date. With that said this authentic Italian restaurant was so good I had to create a Yelp just so I could share. 

What we had:
Lobster Bisque = 5 Stars rich, creamy with chunks of fresh lobster 
Meatball Appetizers = 4 Stars original Italian meatball, very good, I would of liked more herbs and spices but still a delicious meatball
Cheese Tortillini = 5 Stars beautifully plated, delicious pesto sauce, pasta cooked perfectly 

I agree with another yelper about how it's openness in the hotel allows for whoever to walk in and out so you get people who may already be intoxicated walking up to have a cocktail (we had a somewhat loud table near us) but hey it's Vegas and we chose to sit in the bar section....I'm not complaining personally just stating. Didnt take away from the decor and food though.

Excellent service (Tony) who was knowledgable about food and drinks, friendly, and attentive. Even brought out the desert tray at the end but we were full. If your in the area definitly check this place out, worth the $

Surprisingly good. I had my doubts since it seemed overpriced from a glance at the menu, but it was quite good. I had their chicken francese, which is nothing like the typical francese sauce one might expect (creamy, with artichoke hearts and mushrooms). My boyfriend had the lasagna and enjoyed that as well. The atmosphere is very nice and the service is fairly good. They are especially attentive with the water for some reason! We could see parts of the fish tank outside from where we sat in the back...a nice view. Overall, a great experience. Expect to pay $15-$25 for your entree, however.

I don't make my way downtown in Vegas very often, but this place is a MUST-STOP AT when i do. 
The italian home-style salad was very good and the fettuccine alla campagnola was delicious. one of best italian dinners i have ever had.
Service was impeccable and the decor of the restaurant is very nice, even though you are surrounded by the casino on all 4 sides.
the bread with the olive oil was to die for also.
LOVE it.

This restaurant has a very classy Italian feel. The friendly service, classy atmosphere, and delicious food would be typical of places charging $10 more per entree. But the prices were perfectly reasonable. I was with a party of 4 earlier this week, and we all enjoyed our food very much. The menu was great, our server was very helpful, and it was the best meal of our trip!

If you love Italian food, then you must stop in at the Grotto.

We make sure to have a meal here whenever we are in Vegas, and we always stay downtown so it certainly makes it a no brainer.

We haven't had anything that we didn't like.  I am especially fond of the chicken raviolis, the roasted red pepper cream & herbed velout√© sauce is just to die for.   Definitely make sure not to fill up on too much bread before your food comes; it is very easy to do.  From appetizers, to the main course, and then on to dessert you just can not go wrong here.  The service is fantastic and the pricing is very reasonable.

Do not deny their goodness, and SAVE ROOM for dessert the Italian Wedding Cake is a must.

We hadn't been down to the Golden Nugget for awhile and so we decided to head over and have dinner at the Grotto.  

We were quite surprised how busy the whole place was for a Sunday night,  Good for the hotels bottom line, but it was just too busy and a bit too noisy for our liking.

We were seated fairly quickly, (we'd made a reservation) and the hostess was pleasant and provided good service.

It took a bit of a wait for our waitress Carol to get around to us, but when she did, she provided good, friendly and courteous professional service.

The only negative we experienced is that my wife found her dish the Mahi, to be a bit off putting since we hadn't paid attention to the description on the menu.  We called over Neil the manager on duty and he explained the fish was wrapped in angel hair pasta.  (Who ever thought up that idea in our view has a screw loose!  It made the fish yucky to look at and taste). Neil kindly offered to make up a new order without the pasta and it came back perfect.  Much nicer to have a nice piece of fish cooked simply with sauce rather than some sort of pasta concoction wrapping it.  With the pasta it covered the quality of the fish, without it the fish was quite nice and very well done.

Neil, also offered us a comped dessert which we took him up on after we spent some time in the casino.  The tiramisu was yummy and Neil came by and greeted us again, which was quite nice.

Overall, I'd rate our whole experience a B+ on a grading scale.  Quite pleasant, with some minor room for improvements.

The lasagna!!!! Don't the 5 stars say it all!!! I just wish I had a frig and a microwave in the room. The grotto salad is fresh. The bread is so soft and delicious. The fried ravioli dipped in the marinara!!! 
Golden Nugget, Las Vegas, the Grotto, the best. 
Also, Monique was a great server. Very attentive, and funny and informative about what was going on in Vegas for the weekend.
We will always be back.... At least 3 times while we are in town:)))))

Large portions.
Nice Italian food.
Quick service.
Pleasant experience overall.
I'd definitely go back

My friend and I had a night out decided to try this place. OMG we had the most amazing dinner and drinks. Compliments to the chef!! We had the Milanese antipasta. And the  Cannelloni to die for. We also had the martini. We were so pleased with the waiter"Jordan" and the entire staff from start to end. We will be back next time we're in Vegas!!!
Basically did a walk by for tiramisu. Go loved it, so this place is good in my book.

This was a bright spot in a week of generally mediocre food and service.

The service in particular was excellent.  An attentive but not overbearing waiter.  The food was very good and the price was a fair value.

Our best dining experience in Las Vegas.
Really good wood fired pizza oven creates the best pizza! Grab a pizza and drink between 4-6PM great happy hour deal. Beautiful bar and restaurant and friendly staff.

Fourteen of my friends and I had dinner at the Grotto tonight on Fremont Street.  
The service was fabulous although we only had one waitress and she handled it well.  

PROS:  The chopped salad was great and there was a huge plate of it, enough for 6 of us to share.

The Spaghetti Bolognese was good but just good, not great, not memorable. At $19.00 per plate it SHOULD have been better. 

The Chicken Piccata was also a good choice with lots of lemon and loaded with capers and served with a generous helping of angel hair pasta and asparagus.

A few in our party ordered the cannaloni appetizer ($9.00 each) and loved it.   

CONS:  The thin crust pizza fell apart under the weight of the large amount of cheese, sausage and peppers.  The crust tasted more like crackers than pizza dough.  The flavor of the pizza topping was very good, but hard to handle.

We shared all of these  dishes among 6 of the 14 so we ordered 4 extra meatballs along with the two that came with the Spaghetti Bolognese.  The meatballs were huge but we felt that $4.00 for each meatball was a little over the top. 
 
The dessert cart is very interesting to look at but the coconut cream pie (a huge slice) was almost all whipped cream.  I would have liked a little more coconut cream.   At $8.00 per slice it was hard to swallow.  LOL.

The restaurant itself is loaded with Italian atmosphere and very comfortable but noisy.  Some tables face the awesome aquarium at poolside so try to ask for a table there. 

Probably won't go back there again and that's too bad since we're locals and frequent the restaurants on the Strip and Fremont Street.

This is fabulous place for happy hour.  The mussels were so fresh, cooked well and sitting in the best gravy, Italian speaking.  They were so good we ordered them again.  The cocktails during happy hour were far better than we thought they would be for a happy hour.  Grotto's didn't use cheap, nasty tasting well liquor for their drinks.  We sat there for several  hours enjoying the mussels, drinks and each other.  The wait staff was prompt, anticipated our needs and was very friendly.  We will definitely go there again.

The 4 stars was because of the smoke coming up from the slot banks where there were many people playing where it seemed everyone smoked.  If it were not for that, I would  easily give a 5 star.  Just note there are tables not next to slots banks...get one of those $8 pizzas a meal in and of itself.  Everything we saw on other tables looked fantastic.

MANGA!
The best service I have received since moving here. Excellent bread, bruschetta, and pasta.

We had a wonderful Waiter Gary I believe his name was.  I will tell you he was on it. We went there wednesday July 20 in the afternoon and had some dip for an app and some pasta with meatballs and IT WAS TO DIE FOR, the best meal in the entire 6 days I was in Vegas!!!!!

check it out for some really good Italian food!!!
Ate here twice while in Vegas in December (we stayed at the Nugget).  Very good food.  Try the pizza. It's amazing.

We all decided to go here for lunch the food wasn't that great for the price. The spaghetti just tasted like tomato sauce very plain like cafe food. I like Italian salad just not this salad the way they made it I didn't like it. I only liked the tomato bisque soup that tasted the best. Maybe order other pasta is a good idea if you dine here. The Shirley Temple had a lot of cherry flavor in it and was good just I prefer a little less cherry flavor.

Incredible veal. My favorite in Vegas for their veal dishes. I agree, the service is less than stellar. But the vibe is nice and the food always very, very good. This seems to be the trend in Vegas. So many places offer mediocre service in Las Vegas and this is just one of them. To be in a city that needs to remain top notch, service needs to be impeccable - always. This would be 5-stars if the service matched the kitchen.

This was a mediocre restaurant. We arrived when they opened at 11:30. We had the bruschetta for an appetizer, I ordered the chicken Marsala and my husband the meatball panini. The chicken was good but the Marsala sauce wasn't very flavorful. My Husband loves the fries. The sandwich was soggy and didn't have much flavor.

The food here is amazing for the price. I had gnocchi and tomato basil soup. Blew me away. We were seated very quickly and hostess was awesome. Only issue I had with the visit was we almost had to file a missing persons report due to the face we had no idea where the FUCK our waiter was the whole time!

Very delightful experience with delicious meals. We had the wedding soup and rigatoni with meatballs and meat sauce. Both were served hot. It meal came with hot bread and dipping oil infused with basil and garlic.

Amazing !!!!!  Customer service was sooo good. Honestly one of the best places. We had a party of 5. And got two apps to starts sooo good. And then shared three pastas. Sooo amazing !  Meatballs to die for. Next time I'm in Vegas I'm coming back.

OLD VEGAS ITALIANO 

Came here with a group of my co-workers to celebrate the MARCH BIRTHDAYS. 

The resteraunt is located right next to the hotel pool & they have an awsome view of the shark tank too. The decor make me think of how an italian resteraunt looked like back in the days. There were also cool looking blown glass chandeliers. The lighting was dim & the place was packed.

We had a party of 5 & the host seated us quickly followed by our server to greet us. I wish I remembered his name because he is what made this review a 5 star. He was very professional & informed us about the specials for the night. 

We started off with some cocktails that came out quickly & he gave us a few minutes to look over the menu.
We were given hot fluffy bread at the beginning and with some garlic infused olive oil.

TOMATO CAPRESE $12.99 - we ordered 2 and they split it up for us and also added one more mozzarella-tomato-basil & so each dish got 2 pieces which was nice but we couldn't even eat more than one because they were so big. 

LOBSTER BISQUE $9.99 - it was nice & delicious but definately cannot have one serving to myself

SPINACH & ARTICHOKE DIP $9.99 - can't really go wrong with this appetizer 

PENNE CON GAMBERI AL LIMONE $20.99 - this was the dish I ordered & I have to say that it was just okay. The pasta it self could have used more flavoring because it was a bit bland... the shrimps had a lot of flavor though.

PROSCIUTTO-WRAPPED CHILEAN SEABASS $29.99 - it was delicious... presentation was a little plain but it was gonna be eaten regardless. The seabass was cooked to a perfect medium temperature.

CIOPPINO $35.99 - this was a flavor packed dish. Lots of different seafood from clams to crab claws with the flavorful broth it comes in.

ITALIAN CHOPPED $17.99 - the dressing was tossed in & there was a bite of every ingredient of tomato.onion.feta.kalamata olives. Grilled chicken. The chicken was also juicy & not dried out.

CHICKEN PICATTA $19.99 - didn't get to try this one ahhahaha

COCONUT CREAM PIE $7.99 - OMG it was just filled with cream but there was just enough toasted coconuts on the outside to give a little texture & flavor along with the pie crust.

TIRAMISU $7.99 - you could taste a little bit of the alcohol which was great & it literally melted away the moment it touched your toungue which is exactly what I look for in a tiramisu! The decor presentation was cute too.

CREME BRULEE $7.99 - simple but the least of my favorites out of all the desserts but only because it just tasted like a really good normal creme brulee. The sugar crust on top was perfect & the creme inside was creamy soft perfection.

STRAWBERRY CASSATTA $7.99 - my first experience & the light angel cake on the inside was amazing with the cream & fresh strawberries with strawberry sauce... DROOL

CAPACCINO $4.50
BOTTLE OF ARGYLE PINOT NOIR $65

The fact that he lit up a candle for every single one of the desserts was a very awsome touch to the whole dinner. One sad thing was that they didn't offer anything little for dessert which would have just been a nice touch. 

ALL-IN-ALL service was great... ambience & decor was wonderful & fun... food was delcious... didn't really realize timing for everything because we came to dine & enjoy ourselves so you don't realize the timing on anything. But i know we were there for over 2 hours!!! =]

Stayed at the Golden Nugget this past weekend and happened to eat at this place inside.  It was really delicious.  We ordered the pepperoni pizza and caprese.  The ingredients were fresh and I love, love, love the super thin crust on the pizza.  My husband and I split both items and there was nothing left.  Service was excellent, even on a Friday night which was extremely busy.  Yummy, recommend if you like good, fresh Italian food.

I took my hubby here for his birthday we had a great time. The restaurant wasn't very busy because it was two days before Christmas and not many tourists in town. So I told the server it was my husband's birthday hoping that that would get him a free dessert because one of the other restaurants said that if it's your birthday to let them know and that they would accommodate you for such things in Las Vegas. Well not the case here but it was worth it to spend the $8 for dessert we had that Dome cake thingy that has whipped cream and strawberries it was very delicious the restaurant put Happy Birthday in writing on his plate. The pasta was very good and so was the chicken that I had and my husband Seafood dish I forgot what it was called but he loved it. The chef came out to ask if we were pleased with the meal and yes we were. The prices are not bad and the quality is very good. Just don't expect a free be for your birthday or any occasion the waitress said They don't serve freebies for such occasions.

Sat at the bar for a quick glass of wine and to order some food to go. I ordered A glass of red wine. It was good, i don't know if it was worth 9$ a glass though. The bartender seemed a little mad I wanted half spinach, half romain on my Cesar salad. I'm picky, but I am nice about it. We ordered the spinach pear Gorgonzola pizza. It came out cold, and wasn't that amazing. Probably wouldn't come back.

Oh boy.  Where to begin.  We came here for dinner before the 3 Doors Down concert and did not have a pleasant experience.  We ordered a bottle of Querceto.  The first bottle was corked and our server agreed.  We got a new bottle and this one was corked as well.

At this time the GM came over and presented a "special bottle" he had.  It was Match Chardonnay.  You could just tell by looking at the bottle it was nothing special.  

The dinner was OK.  Food was nothing special but our server was definitely trying.

We then got the check and the manager said he would just "price match" the Chardonnay to the $44 bottle of Querceto.  I thought this sounded suspicious as I didn't think the Match bottle was $44.  We then asked for a menu and sure enough "Match Chardonnay" isn't on their menu.  The GM then came over and said he would do their "house Chardonnay" price and on the new receipt it said "Match Chardonnay".

I work in F&B.  I know how menu items and button requests work.  The Match Chardonnay on the receipt said $33.  The unethical GM was trying to nickel and dime us when we had 2 bad bottles of wine.  Is this real life?  

We are foodies and have met several other foodies out and about and have shared our story at any chance we get.  As a general manager or ethical human being your job is to wow the guest and to turn around negative experiences - not to rip the guest off hoping they wouldn't catch what you're trying to do.

This same bottle of wine is offered at Pizza Rock at GVR for $36 or so and they have half off wine night and their wine isn't corked.

Everything about the experience was "meh" but the experience with the GM was absolutely ridiculous.

An absolutely amazing place!! Very cool old world ambience with excellent food. We got there at 11:30 for lunch. It was empty but filled up very quickly. The bartender, Rich was extremely helpful in selecting food and sharing local stories. 

We started with stuffed mushrooms topped with five cheeses in a light tomato basil sauce. I followed this up with the tomato basil soup which was very nice with a cream base. 

We shared a rigatoni Bolognese. It was served  with large tasty meatballs and a tasty chopped salad. The Italian bread - crusty on the outside - came with a very nice olive oil garlic mix. 

Everything was absolutely delicious!! We had way too much food, and took some back to our room for the ride home. 

I almost forgot to mention their famous peach Bellini's. They are made with a mixture of vodka, Pinot Grigio, peaches, peach schnapps, A peachy syrup and of course champagne. It's sweet for my taste but everyone else would just love it. It is made fresh daily.  We will have to try to re-create this without the sweet stuff. 

This place was just like going back to eat in Waterbury, Connecticut where they have great Italian food. Made me feel at home. I miss the good southern Italian cooking from Connecticut.

We went to this restaurant a few years ago for dessert and was served by Arturo. He was awesome and the food was excellent. We brought our family back the next night for dinner. This past weekend, we went back for dessert and we were served by Angela.  This young lady was a delight! We were a crazy bunch and she handled us perfectly. We'll be back for the wonderful food and service.

Oh my gosh! What an awesome place to eat! Robert, the manager was so personable. We felt like we were the only ones here. We had the meatballs to start and they just melted in your mouth. We also had the margheretta pizza (order to crispy) and it was the best pizza I've had in forever. Jason wad our waiter and he was absolutely awesome

During one of my last work trips in Las Vegas, I found myself stationed here at the Golden Nugget and feening for some food after an incredibly intense happy hour.  I learned of the Grotto by accident really - I was busy sipping glasses of wine and attempting to order bar food, only to learn that bar food was a delicious array of Italian fare.

Perhaps it was the alcohol doing the talking for me, because everything I had was inhaled in minutes.  The Montel Wrap, a parmesan crusted Chilean sea bass married with roma tomatoes and lettuce was better drunk food than the burger and fries I was initially fantasizing about.  Another winner was the lasagna and the margherita pizza was deceivingly tasty.  I managed to go back to my hotel room in a pseudo drunken food coma, a condition best experienced in Vegas.

I decided to come back during another night for dinner, this time sober and just as hungry.  Having witnessed the dining room for the first time, I realized it was easy to miss this place.  The Grotto doesn't stand out and the tacky decor wasn't going to win any awards either.  When examining a menu for a second time, it was clear Grotto's was a Italiana Americana restaurant, more than it was anything more authentic.

Service was good, almost too good for a downtown casino establishment.  They were courteous, professional, and prompt with everything.  I had a stellar recommendation in the very tasty ($9) lobster bisque, not too fishy and just a tad of creme.  Another solid dish was the linguine pescatore, but felt overpriced at $27 for a medium portion.  I also was able to try their herb crusted pork loin ($25), juicy and hearty, with a nice seared crust, had a nice flavor with it.  The yukon mashed potatoes were a nice touch but tasted like they were whipped with butter and sour cream.

Finally our table of hungry hippos decided it would be a good idea to order the sausage and peppers pizza.  The crust was a little charred, too much to a point where it was dry and mediocre.  I would give this another shot, especially since I've heard more former colleagues rave about this pizza than any other entree on their menu.

The Golden Nugget has a mini gem here with Grotto.  For downtown standards, this is a decent and semi-reasonably priced Italian option in an area where good food is hard to find.

This restaurant has good food but a little high price for the amount of food. 
The food was tasty and bread was freash and warm but could not get balsamic vinegar for dipping. Kinda strange for Italian? ???
Now the waitress was friendly but she was very slow and the restraunt was empty. They seem to only focus on happy hour. Kind of a shame due to we were paying way more and getting the meal portions.
If your in a hurry eat somewhere else but the food here is worth the wait.

The staff is always great and the food is very good. Nice wine list too. I love CA reds as well as Italians, and they have a great selection on their list. The pizza is excellent and only $8 at happy hour every day (I think). 

The wedding soup is absolutely my favorite and has chicken meatballs instead of beef, perfectly seasoned and easy to slice with your spoon. Light broth, super flavor, soooo Yummy!

I don't eat beef/pork/veal, so my menu choices are limited by my own preferences, so I haven't found an entree that I love yet. The lemon is a bit heavy in their lemon/butter sauce, but the rosa sauce is tasty. We like to grab appetizers and soup at the bar usually anyway, and have never left the Grotto disappointed or hungry! 

The seared mozzarella appetizer is a warm version of caprese (same basic ingredients but cooked and prepared very differently) and we loved it!

Loved Mark our waiter
Loved our dinner, the veal was devine

We will be back!!!

My new husband and I wed and honeymooned at the Golden Nugget so we visited Grotto many times during our 9 day stay.  

Our first experience was the night before our wedding.  
We held meet & greet social to allow our out of town friends to visit with us before all the busyness of the wedding.  Mark was the ideal server who made food and wine suggestions that all 12 of us enjoyed!  The pasta dishes here are excellent but the pizza is definitely the star! All of them are good so choose your favorite with confidence!  The meatball appetizer is also fantastic with its scrumptiously seasoned interior complementing its crunchy exterior - my husband highly recommends this to accompany any dish.

 The Grotto Bar was one of our "go-to" spots when we done sightseeing and wanted a good drink in a nice environment.  They have a full bar and an excellent wine selection.  The big screens were nice as well and during one visit we were able to chill and watch a Giants game!  :D

 As stated earlier, we had several other meals here during our stay (lunch and dinner) and each time the food was outstanding and the service was friendly. You can't miss with Grotto!

Wife and I decided to see what Fremont St was like in the day, so we parked at the Golden Nugget and recently read online that Grotto was a pretty decent place to eat with reasonable prices.  They lived up to my expectations and exceeded.

First off, Hugo was our waiter.  He was very attentive the entire time and very friendly.  I didn't have breakfast that day so I was wanting more of a larger lunch, so I ordered the Grotto spaghetti and meatballs.  Salad and bread first came out.  Salad was good, but the bread was amazing.  Very crusty on the outside and pillow soft and warm on the inside.  Then the lunch came.  The noodles were perfectly al dente, and the two meatballs on it were huge and very tasty and tender.  Perfectly done.  Probably one of the best pasta and meatballs I've had, all for a price that's not overly inflated like a lot of the other restaurants in the downtown area and strip.

I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a good meal at a reasonable price around Fremont St.

I took my girlfriend here for our anniversary dinner because we were staying at the hotel. We ate dinner here and it was bellow par than any other Italian food restaurant I have ever been to. The portions were very small and over priced. The chicken marcella for almost $30 looked like a kids menu portion. Next time I will goto Olive Garden and have better Italian food and their food isn't very good.
Jason recommended the penne shrimp dish its was awesome. Definitely request Jason as your waiter. We will be back

I guess I missed the fine print when I was looking for a late night snack.  There is a happy hour menu after 10:30pm (or maybe it was 10pm).  I went to the hostess in order to place a to go order to take back to my room, but she told me that I had to order at the bar.  I went to the bar and asked about happy hour and the bartender said I had to wait a few minutes.  So I decided to wait.  He did not however say anything about having to eat in restaurant.  After waiting, I went back and tried to get a pizza to go.  I got the receipt and the pizza was $18 - full price.  I asked about the happy hour menu and was told I had to eat there.  I was not in the mood to argue or sit there so I just took paid and waited for the pizza.  All I got was a plain pepperoni pizza.  It was pretty good.  A little salty and the sauce made the crust a little soggy because it was pretty thin.  Not really worth $18, but I guess that's what I get after gambling all day and forgetting to eat dinner.

We waited so long to get any service, after being seated. 25 minutes for us to get water and our order in. No bread until we got our food, no water refill until we received our check. Inexcusable on the management's part. The waitress was running around as fast as she could, but simply had too many tables. Get more people. Your food is delicious and fine, but your service totally ruined my taste buds. With so many options, I'll definitely avoid this place.
Went for lunch during the week. Simple menu. I did really like their Italian salad, the red wine vinegarette was fabulous. Otherwise simple Italian food. Nothing special.

We were in Vegas for a couple of days and decided to check out the happy hour here! We ordered the meat lovers pizza and bellinis!  The pizza was very big, an extremely thin delicate crust and delicious!  We didn't have to add anything to enhance the taste! The bellinis were delicious!  At $8 for the pizza and $4 for the bellinis (we each had two each) it was a great deal!  It was a perfect lunch of the beaten path but worth visiting this restaurant in the Golden Nugget.

This was a great place to eat you won't regret it!  They have an amazing happy hour menu with plenty of appetizers and drinks to choose from. Ricardo our server had a great personality was friendly and efficient! The manager came by and greeted us, he was friendly, service was fast.
Great service and excellent pizza! Try the rotisserie chicken pizza or Gorgonzola pear with balsamic drizzle! Went twice and the price was good! Would definitely return!

Great atmosphere and amazing pizza!  Eat here every time we stay at the Golden Nugget.  

100 A++++
Absolutely terrible-- our entire party was joking at how bad it was. I had the veal and couldn't finish it even though I was still hungry. No one like anything.

Sorry folks but this isn't fine dining. 

I'm spoiled sure. I eat well in Chicago, San Francisco, Miami, NY... and this barely compares with a decent Italian chain restaurant. Honestly, Carrabas is better. 

The price of this joint was ridic. I spent $44 bucks on some bland and mushy mussels, a plate of soggy calamari and a meh salad. I realize seafood might not have been the hot ticket, so I tried my friends dishes. More blah. Where did the flavor go? Ive been to some amazing Italian places, at prices from $ to $$$$. Price doesn't usually indicate quality, but here at this price I expected a lot more. Hell if it was half what I paid I would've been sorely disappointed.

Case in point, we ate at Brio in a mall on the south end of the strip before we flew out. Again it was a meal of seafood appetizers and salad. WITH a bottle of wine it was only $60 bones, and it was phenomenal! and a chain! Seriously, WTF. 

Thankfully Vegas has some amazing food... just. not. here.

Dammit, the restaurant is good!  I've had excellent pizzas and pastas there every time I've stayed at the Nug.  But even better is to hang at the bar, and enjoy the Grotto while you get all blotto.  

Full menu is available at the bar, the staff is funny as hell, and occasional wine refills are included.

Review #11

I ate here last Wed, 26 Feb 14, for a late lunch & the food was superb, but my waitress was very inattentive to refilling my water glass & very offish towards me.  Then a male waiter took over for her but he didn't bother to ask me if I wanted water either & my glass was almost empty.  He also took a long time to bring my check.

I give 3 stars for the food & 1 for the service.  The restaurant was hardly busy since it was 2pm & the normal 11am-1pm lunch crowd was gone.  So I don't know why the wait for my food was so long & my water glass was never refilled.  I left too nice of a tip for the service I received.

Maybe another time the service will live up to the food!

In order to get 5 stars I really have to be wooed so to speak. However this restaurant was great. The server was on point and the pizza was some of the best pizza I have ever eaten. The crust was nice thin and airy. Probably will be a must have every time I want pizza in Vegas. We also had wings. They were good. They have their own flavor combinations for their wings. So thats was a plus. I like to experience different and new things. This was definitely a  pleasurable one. Give it a go. You wont be disappointed.

We had my Aunty's 80th bday party here Saturday night we had a group of about 36. This is located inside the Golden Nugget in Downtown Las Vegas. it was a set dinner course I had the breaded chicken with penne (can't remember the name) w/ a Caesar salad and dessert Strawberry cheesecake. Service was excellent here we had 4 people catering to us and all four of them were outstanding my other Aunt and I were the special ones at the table cause on my meal i didn't want mushrooms and artichokes mixed with the sauce on my chicken so the guy put the special order for me and my Aunt didn't want the Strawberry cheesecake or the chocolate cake that we had to choose from so the guy brought her ice cream instead. Another thing was i dropped one of my med pills it was a very small white round pill so as i looking under the table for it with flashlight and all the girl waitress came over got on all floors to look for it way beyond the call of duty we couldn't find it luckily i had extra. She was a trooper going underneth the table and all. I would definitely come back here to eat again. Overall great food and great to see family that came from Ohio, Texas, and Hawaii. Sorry no pics i chowed down my food so fast lol.

We come here every single time we are on Vegas six or 7 times a year. The food is always consistently exceptional. Two of our favorite dishes are Chicken Marsalis and the Veal Parm. All of the deserts are incredible so save room.
The best thing about Grotto is the customer service. They hold a very high standard and I have never seen it slip

Love this place !!! Pizza is awesome !!! Jeff K. Is by far the best server I have encountered in a long time .. I have been back numerous times because of him , and will continue to visit whenever possible !!! Oh yeah and the peach Bellini's yumm !!!!

been coming to the grotto for a few years and raving about there amazing pepperoni pizza, but alas times they are a changing, must have new chef a once brilliant standout pizza is now just and average pizza, the peeperoni they once used seems to be no longer and replaced with a dominoes style pepperoni and the bread and pasta dishes have suffered a setback as well looks like one place I can cross off the list when we visiit vegas, sometimes change is not good

We stopped here while visiting Fremont Street.  As an aside, the Golden Nugget has been nicely kept up through the years and holds its own with resorts on the Strip.  Anyway, we expected Grotto to be an expensive version of Olive Garden, but we were pleasantly surprised.  

First of all, our waitress was wonderful.  She helped us choose entrees, and suggested that we split a salad.  Hubby had a sea bass encrusted with a pasta-type coating.  He thought it was terrific.  I had a veal marsala, which was very good.  Our side dishes were also very well done.  

The desserts were the best!  When you're done eating, they wheel out a dessert cart.  Naturally, everything makes your mouth water.  We shared a cake layered with cream and strawberries.  Light and decadent!  

The atmosphere was okay -- we got to look out into the pool and fish tank area.  My only complaint would be the noise.  Like most restaurants in Vegas, the restaurant is open to a corridor with people constantly walking through. 

If you're downtown and want to eat at a nice Italian restaurant, I would highly recommend Grotto.

I came here with a large dinner party and where we were seated in the room to the left of check in.  That night it seemed to consist of just large parties.  So as far as being located in Vegas downtown I think it's a great venue for celebratory occasions.  I only tried three items, the bread, artichoke & spinach dip, and the Cannelloni di Pollo.  It would have been nice to have vinegar on the table along with the oil for the bread.  I thought the artichoke and spinach dip was okay.  I found it to be a little watery for my taste.  I enjoyed my Cannelloni di Pollo.  It was only an an appetizer portion but after stuffing my face with bread it was the perfect portion.  Being that it was a large party I was pleasantly surprised that the waitress gave us all separate checks.  I know none of us were expecting that as we were prepared with cash.  

Will I go here again?  Probably not.  There is just much better Italian food in Vegas at a much better price point.
Love this place, the ambience is amazing.  The chickem parmesean is my favorite.  My husband and I purposely go two times a month for date night!! Everyone is always pleasant:)

Very delicious. Large plates. I ordered the chicken and spinach cannelloni. We also ordered Caesar salads. My food and everyone's was delicious.  Very fast service as well.  We were in a time crunch to get to our shared ride in 12 minutes and were able to finish her food, get our check, and then proceed to the Uber stand!  Even though it says it's only 2 $'s it's a little closer to the three $'s. With all that in mind remember it's enough to feed two people.

I had the special pizza of the day ($10 to eat in, $15 to go), artichoke, garlic, tomatoes w/olive oil.  It was a bland dry cracker crust with gluey cheese and maybe four bits of artichoke in the center, very little topping.  It was horrible.

I was staying down at The Plaza for a week long event and was dying to get out of there.  So my friend and I took a stroll down Freemont Street and happened upon the Golden Nugget.  We cruised in and found the Grotto.  Italian food...PERFECT.

It was a Tuesday night but it was very crowded.  We were seated within a few minutes and the gluttony began.  We started with Stuffed Mushrooms...always a perfect start.  We ordered a bottle of Reisling Wine...can't remember which brand but it was good.  We both left with a little buzz and that was even after we ate so much.  Next we moved onto the Tomato Caprese Salad...delicious.  

For my main course I ordered the Penne Diavolo and my friend got the Seared Sea Bass.  Both dishes were superb.  And what meal wouldn't be complete without a little Creme Brulee to top it off.  Our service was excellent and the food was wonderful...by far the best meal I had my entire stay in Vegas.

We had to walk around Freemont Street to keep from going into a food coma but it as well worth it.  I'll be back here again the next time I'm in the area!
This place is amazing, authentic Italian food, friendly staff. Pizza is amazing. Warm and welcoming.

The Stawberry Cassata dessert at The Grotto is the entire reason I planned our trip to Vegas February 20th. We had previously eaten here in 2007. My husband does not typically go for dessert, sweets, cakes or much breadish items in general, but he loves strawberries, so the first time here he ordered it, and has talked about it for years!! I have called several locations trying to have a cake shipped to me around his birthday with no luck! So this year I thought "I'm just taking him to that cake!" One we arrived for our 7PM reservations we were offered patio seating for our special occasion and the gorgeous weather! It took a while to be greeted by our server, but we are typically leisurely and understanding at restaurants, especially on vacation! Another server made sure we were okay and insured that we had been helped by someone. Another table was a little more displeased and vocalized it to us. Having worked in food years ago, I'm more patient and understanding, especially when it seems someone is "in the weeds". All in all our server was great, food was delicious! The manager directed me to the restroom, and helped me have this cake brought out to my husband with a candle. We hope the next time we're here is much sooner than 7 years!

Two days ago I was spending my last night in Vegas. A friend and I decided to go to Fremont street to look for souvenirs and see the lights so we decided to look up a place on online/yelp. I found grotto ristorante had pretty good reviews, didn't look extremely pricey, and we wanted to see the golden nugget anyways so I thought we'd give it a try.

I don't have a bad word to say about this place but my expectations weren't that high either. I got linguine pescatore and it was AMAZING! I loved that there was so much seafood piled on that I couldn't even see the pasta at first. The service was excellent and I loved that we got seated by the pool where we could watch people go down the slide and watch the Sharks/fish swim. My friend and I also stayed for dessert. She got tiramisu and I got orange creme br√ªl√©e. I got to taste her tiramisu and both desserts were amazing. This ended up being my favorite meal in Vegas!

Enjoyed two fabulous lunches at this beautiful restaurant inside the Golden Nugget with great decor inside or views overlooking the busy pool area with huge shark tanks..  The chicken Marsala wAs one of the best I've ever had, rich and delicious atop of tender risotto.  The side veggies the chef made for us included various squash, which was super fresh and perfectly all dente.  The pizza was good though a little soggy.  The service and the wine list was superb.  Best of all, it doesn't not break your piggy bank.  I look forward to returning.

I was excited to try this place out, lots and lots of great reviews; the place is within the Golden Nugget and right across from the shark tank.

We had a reservation for a party of 14, and they were able to accommodate us, our server Denise was chatty and friendly, she asked where we were all from, it was an even split between California and Arizona. She even remembered most of our names, and she told us she was 63, man she didn't look it at all! Life has been kind to her.

After glancing over the menu 1st thing that caught my eye, damn this place is pricy, for a bowl of spaghetti and sauce was 20 bucks, that stuff better be amazing!  Also on the table they brought out fresh sourdough bread and oil with spicy herbs, that was pretty tasty too, the bread was delish!

So after the sticker shock, I went with the Pollo Romano and small Caesar salda (additional 4.99 charge). The Caesar salad had crisp romaine lettuce, garlic croutons, a great tasting Caesar dressing and was blanketed in Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese. It was a great tasting salad,

The Pollo Romano, on the menu had great potential, it Romano-crusted chicken scaloppini with artichokes & Roma tomatoes in a white wine sauce served with penne sugo rosa for $19.99, I guess I should have really pay attention to the scaloppini part of the chicken, man my chicken was small, almost to the point of not being there, it was 2   pieces about the size of a half dollar and as thin as a sheet of paper, super small, piled on top a heaping mound of spinach with 1 artichoke heart cut in half propped to make the chicken appear bigger and to the side of this was a huge mound of pasta with minimal sauce, so very disappointed in my dinner, did it taste good, yea the 2 bites of chicken was great in flavor, the white wine sauce was thin and sparse, the mound of spinach felt like it was never ending, and the pasta was cooked all the way but was very dry. I do not feel this meal was worth the price. Everyone was under wowed by their meal, but had a great time enjoying everyone's company.

Sometimes you can't believe the hype of a place, and I feel this place falls in that category.

A Delicious Meal !
From start to finish, we loved our experience at the Grotto.  Our server, Steven, couldn't have been more pleasant and helpful.  After reading reviews we tried the meatballs and weren't disappointed.  My husband thought they tasted like mine, which he loves !  Our entrees were two pizzas as we love east coast thin pizza and it is hard to find.  This pizza was great....the crust was really thin, almost cracker like on the edges and so delicious.  I loved the flavor of the cheese.  Save room for dessert because the cheesecake is like we had in NY and they have a yummy angel cake with strawberries.  We were happy to take home half of our pizzas and half of our desserts.  Seating was comfortable, warm bread served when you are seated...a really first class experience !!

Love this place. This is my second time In Vegas and my first time visiting Fremont street. My boyfriend found the Grotto online and we saw it had great reviews, so why not give it a try?

We had reservations at 5. We got there and the hostess told us that she could seat us but if we wanted to sit at a table in the bar area, drinks pizza and other apps were on happy hour so we gave it a try.

Turns out, we took the gamble and it paid off. Mike was our waiter and second to none. He was the only server In our area and took exceptional care of us. I think a lot of people forget that servers are people too and they aren't your servants (like other tables we're treating him), so we grabbed his attention, got to know him and I could not have asked for a better server. 

Mike was personable, kept the drinks flowing until happy hour was over and provided amazing service. The food was delicious (one of the best pizzas in Vegas) and drinks were on point. 

When I come back, I will most definitely visit the Grotto again. Great food, great drinks, and great people. It's in the middle of the golden nugget, so it's convenient and has a great ambience. Stop by and check it out - and remember, don't be rude to your server. They are people too and deal with a bunch of rude people, so don't be one. Ask for mike!

The food was amazing, the servers are great, she refilled my soft drink a few times before I even got my entree. She accidentally made a mistake with my order; the restaurant was loud and she might've misheard. But then had it corrected right away and even went as far as to take it off the bill because it was her honest mistake. I appreciated that so much. I would come back here for the service. It's a little slow, but it's understandable because it was busy and the food was very fresh.

We were so impressed with this place! 

The service was amazing. She recommended a great bottle of wine. We split an appetizer, salad, and dinner. All of which they served already split. We had an amazing view of the pool shark tank. Even though we were seated next to a large part the service never suffered. 

We walked in looking for something for dinner and were torn between this place and RAW (sushi). We know we made the right decision. The bruschetta was wonderful! And it's large. Really more than enough for 3+. We split the most comparable thing to a dinner salad, which was more like a chopped salad. It also was more than enough. It would have been too big for one if ordered with a meal. Finally we shared one of the house pasta specials (the name escapes me) with roasted peppers and sausage. Again, it was great. 

The pricing was better than anything you would get up in "new" Vegas. The service was amazing. My only complaint... It didn't come up on my search on Yelp. I just happened to stumble in. YOU MUST TRY THIS PLACE.

A group of us went for happy hour the other day and enjoyed a few drinks and appies in the bar area. It wasn't busy, as we went on a Tuesday around 2:30pm - but the service was quite slow despite the near empty bar area. 

I had Peroni ($5) and a shrimp cocktail ($13.95) which was extremely overpriced for the happy hour portion, which was 4 smallish prawns. Not very high quality, and they were a bit over-cooked. Our table also had the stuffed mushrooms and an order of bruschetta, which was quite tasty. I would go back for the drink specials, but I'd rather eat somewhere else for better food.

When I am working on concert productions nearby on another property, while most of the crew will bring lunch, head to McDonalds or use catering if the band provides it, I like stepping away from the production, sitting at the bar, watching the chefs make pizza in a wood fire oven and ordering a nice lunch or dinner. Sometimes I will take a crew member or two with me. Last Saturday I had the Italian Chopped Salad with some hot bread. His the spot and priced right. I am told they have a great happy hour. I will have to check that out when I am not working.

I was very pleased with my dining experiences at Grotto.  I had three meals at Grotto over my Vegas weekend vacation.

On the first occasion I shared the house salad, Chilean sea bass and strawberry cake dessert with my fianc√©.  The kitchen split up our meals which were the perfect portion.  I'm not a fish person but I really enjoyed my meal.

On the second visit I went for happy hour and had a margarita pizza - yum!! Great drink specials too.

Finally I had my wedding reception here with 26 guests and Grotto delivered amazing service and food.  I definitely recommend this venue if you are looking for an affordable (about $40-50 per person), intimate restaurant with various dinner options.  Guests were able to choose from 2 salads, 3 entrees and 2 desserts - all of which were very tasty!  Upon first visiting Grotto, I was a little considered about privacy because they don't have a private dining room.  Our party was set up against the back wall of the restaurant and luckily it still felt like our own special event.

I'm so happy I went with this restaurant!  I basically planned my wedding using yelp reviews and if there's anyone needing a lovely setting for a large party, nice dinner out or decent happy hour, I strongly advise considering Grotto!

Great food, service sucked. MICHAEL was a terrible waiter and not attentive whatsoever. After we got our food we didn't see him anymore. I had to pretty much shout out for his attention and I told him we had been waiting for acknowledgement for the last 15 mins and he didn't say a word or apologize. It wasn't even that busy. Very very rude waiter who if I were a manager of this restaurant, I wouldn't want him as a representative. Because of him and his unacceptable service I do not think we will come back

I was simply stunned at how delicious and seemingly authentic the food was here. I hope the next time I dine here the food stays consistent, the chef who was working the nights I've went is GOOD! I grew up eating my way through North Beach w/my Grandmum, so we are a bit snobbish and jaded when it comes to our Italian food. I was surpirsed to find something this good in Downtown Las Vegas. I love sitting in the extended dining room area so I can check out the pool!   ;)

Great Italian restaurant inside the Golden Nugget. Drove to Vegas with my wife and daughter. I let my daughter Google and yelp top restaurants in Vegas. She came up with Grotto. We made her feel good and tried it out. My daughter and yelp were dead on. Great food, great service and a spectacular view of the pool & shark tank aquarium. We highly recommend Grotto. I would have given it 5 stars but it's  in downtown Vegas inside the Golden Nugget off Freemont St.

Our waiter Darwin was prompt. He kept our waters topped off and our bread basket full. We had the antipasti, pepperoni pizza (we requested it with extra meat) and rigatoni and meatballs. It was all good.

It was disappointing to look back at the windowed kitchen and see cans of tomato sauce though. 

Our meals were largely portioned and I boxed up half my rigatoni and 1 meatball. Thanks, Darwin!
Absolutely one of the best places to eat and drink downtown! Great bartenders, great food, and a fun atmosphere!

I'm giving it 4 stars because the service was really excellent. The food is OK, but my kudos goes to our superb server that took care of us. We got there maybe 30 minutes before they closed (do they close?) and got seated with a view on the pool / aquarium outside.

Appetizer: Calamari - Not so good, it smelled fishy. Our server offered to take it back and have them make a fresh batch of the stuff after he saw we had hardly touched it.

The pizza I ordered was really good...and really BIG! Do NOT order one of these for yourself, they are big enough for two. The margherita pizza was delicious and really hit the spot. Also had a glass of their house red to go with it.

This is probably one of the nicer places to eat in the Freemont area.

My family and I had a fabulous dinner at Grotto!  It was my birthday and we received excellent service!  Our waiter, Steven, couldn't have been any nicer and was very attentive!  I ordered the Herb Roasted Chicken Pizza and a mixed green salad!  Both were very yummy!!!  The rest of my party were very happy with their selections as well!  The night was topped off by a wonderful, huge slice of cheesecake!  We will definitely be back on our next visit to Las Vegas!!!

We took a trip to downtown Vegas to explore and had dinner at Grotto's.  We ordered the Bruschetta (7.99) which was grilled Tuscan bread served with marinated Roma tomatoes and the Peperoni pizza (12.99) which is imported peperoni, tomatoes and homemade mozzarella.  Both were very flavorful and yummy.  And cheap to boot considering the pricey food we'd been eating all week.

Review for happy hour only. It's decent, though the drinks are not as cheap as I'd like to see at a downtown happy hour. Wells, wine and beer for $5-7. Our pizza was cold when it arrived, but it was only $7 so I'm not too upset. 

Service was alright, except for the pizza incident. Drink glasses stayed full and we hung out for about an hour and a half and spent $40. Not bad for a weekday afternoon, I suppose.

Phenomenal.
I am quite the snob when it comes to Italian food, but this place is a gem.
After walking around Fremont street for an hour looking for a place to eat, we stumbled upon this place and the exquisite aroma of the food is what drew us in. For a party of 5 on a Saturday night with no reservation we we're sat right away. 
What impresses me in any restaurant is a server who is passionate about what they serve and ours was just that. She was knowledgable about the wine and food pairings and recommended great dishes. 
Antipasti- 5 stars
Cannelloni Di Pollo- 4 stars
Chicken Picatta- 4 stars
Tiramisu- 5 stars
But what blew me away was the Margherita Pizza. Wow. Thin, crispy crispy baked in a stone oven. Just wow. And the flavor is to die for. I'd go back I Vegas just for this pizza.
Very romantic seating, worth getting dressed up for.

The location right by the shark tank pool is great. I had pizza and the fired mozzarella, both were excellent. I tried two other dishes from my group, spaghetti and a cream pasta dish... I'm glad I didn't order what they did but again mine was really good. I would absolutely recommend this place for a nice lunch!

Excellent! came here last week with the bf because we were staying in the hotel and didn't want to drive to restaurants. it was christmas day so no reservations were needed. we got seated right next to the window so you can see the aquarium/pool. lovely view. 

i see some comments here about good the bread was, but that was probably the least stand out thing about this place. i had the rigatoni salsiccia which was BOMB!! the server said it was going to be spicy but i was like, please woman i'm asian i can handle any spicy food. and sure enough, it wasn't :( but still delicious. so many restaurants have bland pasta but this is not one of them. the bf had the roasted herb chicken pizza which is fair in size and sooo goood. the goat cheese was divine. oh yea and the lobster bisque!! might be the best one i've ever had!

I was tooling around Fremont and got a hankering for some red sauce italian. Grotto at the Golden Nugget was just what i needed.  I had the rigatoni bolognese and meatballs.  It looked delicious. It didnt blow me away but it was enjoyable. The taste is roughly on par with an Olive Garden but with better presentation in a better atmosphere.  The bolognese sauce was on the sweet side and the meatballs were pretty bland.  I suppose if you have an aversion to heavy amounts of garlic or cheese then this is ideal.  Prepare to augment with grated parmesan or even salt and pepper.   Despite the negatives I brought up, i would hit Grotto again next time Im in the area.

Food: 4.5/5
Decor: 4.5/5
Price: 3.5/5
Service: 5/5
Overall: 4/5

Grotto must be the best restaurant at the Golden Nugget Casino & Hotel. I had the Paglia E Fieno with chicken which was phenomenal. The service was great because my friends mom and grandma had to go to the airport at 7:30, so she asked if they can get our orders out quickly and they did. I wish I still had room for desert because the desert cart looked amazing. I highly recommend Grotto over Carson Cafe at the Golden Nugget any time. I would most definitely return when I'm around Downtown Las Vegas.

Oh my amazing! How can I express in words what we experienced last night? Our waitress attended to every need-including my dietary issues. The chef prepared an amazing GF & DF pasta for me that I keep dreaming about & want to eat again. This place is a true find for us Vegas locals. We can't wait to go back!!!

The meatballs and chicken dishes are great but the service is a boo boo.  The waiter forgot one of our meals plus we had to search for him.  If they improve their service, we will certainly come back.
Great service and great food. Pizza is awesome. Before six eat in bar area so  get same food but happy hour price. Very pleased.

Was craving Italian and got great service, delicious Italian, and fabulous setting! This was located in "Old Vegas"  and right inside the Golden Nugget, short walk from the hotel lobby. 

There are two sections of seating and one is "inside" the restaurant while there is an outer area that hugs the huge glass walls, where you can look into the pool and aquarium / slide! It was really nice to zone out and have a nice view.

We ordered a salad (big enough to share between 2 or even 3), bruschetta, mushroom caps, and almost couldn't eat it all as we scarfed down the warm bread that came to our table shortly before. 

Everything we ordered was to our liking and even with one member of our dining party being extremely rude and cranky (sorry!!) the wait staff was ever so gracious and patient.

Located super close to the Fremont experience, will definitely add this place as a must stop for a meal while in Vegas. 

Valet parking is free and tip based so make sure to tip them.
Delicious food, wonderful staff, warm atmosphere.  We could not have had a better time.  We go to vegas frequently so we will definitely be back.  If you want really great italian food, go here!

i typically only review the food at a restaurant but the service deserves mention in this review.  i've been here a couple of times for both dinner and lunch and i need to read my review before i return next time.  the wood fired pizza is actually pretty good.  it's thin and crispy and well balanced.  everything else i've had isn't so  great.  on my last visit we started with bruscetta.  the plate was heaping with toasty bread topped with tomatoes, basil, olive oil and balsamic.  it looked nice but the tomatoes had no flavor.  the bread had been toasted hours prior, and the olive oil and balsamic were low quality.  for dinner i ordered a chicken dish with wine and mushrooms.  it was ok but it took more than an hour to come to the table after our apps were finished.  this is where i mention the service.  not once did the server come over and update us on our meal.  i understand there are sometimes issues with orders getting lost or not being placed.  or the kitchen just running slow.  what i don't understand is how a server can completely ignore a table for an hour.  small consolation at the end of the meal she bought a dessert for the table.  unfortunately it wasn't very good either.
My husband and I went here back in October. This place was amazeballs. He got the veal which was outstanding and I got a pizza which was also outstanding. I miss this place.

We decided to give the Grotto a try before a play in the Arts District.  As Dana said in his review, this is pretty standard fare in an over-priced casino restaurant.

First our iced tea orders were taken and we were brought some slices of standard Italian bread with a container of olive oil for dipping. 

I ordered the special of the day, a risotto with lump crab.  My wife ordered the Pollo Romano, a chicken breast--"Romano crusted chicken scaloppine" and served with penne in a sugo rosa.  My wife's chicken was very good but there was more of a breading taste than romano to the chicken.  The penne was very bland.  A little salt helped that along.  My risotto was good and there was a fair amount of crab meat.

We shared a slice of mezza notte chocolate cake.  It's very rich and very good.  Lots of chocolate drizzled with chocolate.

Service was good.  Iced tea was refilled and the server took my Landry's card early and linked it to our order.
