The bread is perfect, crusty on the outside warm and soft on the inside. Everything we ordered was amazing. The pasta with Gorgonzola sauce was amazing and big enough to share. The lasagna was just the right size. The desserts looked wonderful but we were all too full to even think about dessert.

Great restaurant, happy hour menu is excellent.  Shame the staff notably Charlie / Chuck behind the bar don't match the food and drink. This man is arrogant, curses in front of the customers and slams down liquor bottles and cocktail shakers and is generally rude.  Several parties had a problem when I'd visited there this week (having previously been there several times and never encountered him personally but not been served by him) and the manager just told us he was going to "have a conversation" with him.  Disappointing.

Had a nice lunch at Grotto the last time we were in town. We were meeting my junior high school classmates for lunch. Our flight got in a little before lunchtime so we made our way to Downtown soon after retrieving our rental car. Grotto is located inside the Golden Nugget Casino & Hotel. I'm very familiar with the Nugget having stayed there in the past but had never dined at Grotto. One of our classmates is a Vegas local and suggested dining there. It was definitely a good call. 

We ordered calamari for our table and I went with the grilled chicken panini minus the mozzarella. It also came with roma tomatoes and mayo. The sandwich was very good. The grilled chicken was tasty and not dry. The chicken was also cut into pieces and I was real happy with it. The waffle fries the panini came with were very good. I really liked them. Nicely seasoned and went well with the panini. Good sandwich. I would get again in the future. The plate came with a small bowl of ketchup for dipping the waffle fries. I liked that. 

Other entrees ordered at our table were the portabello panini, pizza and pasta bolognese. Everyone was very happy with their individual orders. The calamari was great. It came with marinara dipping sauce and lemon to squeeze accordingly. Great appetizer. 

Service was good. Water for everyone. A moscow mule. sodas... All brought to our table with a smile. Manager on duty was very personable and we enjoyed our meal at Grotto for sure. Definitely a place to check out when at or around the Nugget.

First, the service was poor.  We ordered salads which were brought to us 40 min after we ordered and before we even started the salads, soup was brought to us.  It took another 45 min to get our main courses.  The salad was fair, the soup was dishwater, the main courses of encrusted Mahimahi was testless, the pasta was overcooked, the other main course, chicken, was covered in a sludge sauce.  Skip this restaurant.  There are other good Italian restuarants in Las Vegas

I rarely hit up the Nugget, but not blind to the fact that it's probably the best hotel casino north of the strip.

My visit with a homie was due to a small wedding reception dinner at a nearby chapel.  Can you say elope?  Congrats to the love birds Moses and Bree!  Unfortunately, we missed the wedding reception by more than an hour, but made it for the dinner...you could say that we was behaving like we was really related to the bride and groom, lol.  So I played the role of that uncle that just comes through something on everything, and when everything is all "ate" and done, it's deuces! J/k... 

At first glance, I thought this was just your average casino diner filed with transient d-bags, bit not at all the case.  A look at the menu, and a brief Yelp review, quickly changed my mind.  The use of space is efficient and doors a good job with separating the restaurant from the casino floor.  A view of the pool and shark tank was a pleasant surprise as well.  

My buddy and I opted to split the chicken herb pizza since it was a small informal dinner with the bride and grooms closest associates.  There is also a full bar and local brewery beer selection.  That alone can make this man happy.  The pizza was astounding, anything with goat cheese is a major plus for me, bit the overall pizza was scrumptious nonetheless.

Although, our late arrival prevented me from peeping out everyone else's offers.  I love marveling over others' orders to plan my next attack, lol.  I did see some oversized meatballs and pasta specialties, enough to know there are some good stuff on the menu.  A return trip is in order the next time I'm downtown.

I would have to give this experience an overall 3.5, making it a 4-star review.  The pizza was superb and the drinks were flowing with attentive service.  Exceeding my expectations definitely played a part in the rating.  Mazal Tov!

Initially I chose The Grotto because they have cable TV and the NFL game I wanted to watch was on the TV. 
I had no idea it would be So Awesome!!
To start I ordered  the Lobster Bisque it was FANTASTIC perfect lobster flavor with just enough cream and sherry & Chunks of Lobster meat!!
One of the best I've ever had!
I asked for a special order Margherita Pizza - I wanted the tomatoes added after baking with the fresh basil.
It was Delicious!!  Thin crispy crust too!!
My Water glass was never empty and my Moscow Mules were served in the copper cup!!

The service was FABULOUS, FRIENDLY & EFFICIENT!!

I will definitely return!

Here on business. Daniel was my server and did a fantastic job. Very helpful in making decisions and explaining the menu. The view of the pool is amazing. Ordered artichoke dip and the penne garneri al limone. Wow! Def a must go to.

Stopped in here for happy hour at the bar (2-6pm, Monday thru Friday). Happy hour specials include $4 beer bottles, $7 pizza, $5 martini and wine. The margherita pizza is actually quite decent. Service is a bit on the slower side but not terrible.

Strumming through my Yelp bookmarks, I was unsure of where I'd like to go eat. You'd think with 75+ bookmarks, I could come up with something on the fly. Nope. 

We were driving without a destination, with only the mutual purpose to find a restaurant somewhat near Cashman Field before Beau S. and went to the game. Remembering the wonderful smell wafting out of the Italian restaurant at the Golden Nugget two weeks prior, we ended up at Grotto.

At close to 5 PM yesterday (4/18/11) the place was empty. I don't know why but almost every time I go out to eat, the restaurants seem to be completely void of life. Our waitress took a bit to come take our order. Beau ordered an appetizer of fried ravioli after I noticed how small the $13 antipasti platter was that another table ordered. They were decent, but came with 8 pieces. I'm unsure of the exact price, but I know they were overpriced.

Beau ordered the chopped salad ($15) and I ordered the lobster bisque ($9) My soup was good but a bit small of a portion. Beau salad was more of a pulverized salad. The lettuce was chopped up into lady bug sized portions and he ended up eating the cheese out of it and leaving a bunch of salad still on the plate when we left. 

The waitress was neither good nor bad. I think she forgot to bring us the bread basket and more refills would have been nice. Honestly, for $38ish, I think we could have gotten better food somewhere else.

After passing The Grotto many times and always noting how good the food looked, I finally got to try it. Had a margherita pizza as an appetizer, it was okay. Nothing more. Will skip that next time. But being from NYC it's also hard for me to be impressed by any other pizza! My boyfriend ordered penne diavolo, had a great flavor. I had shrimp primavera it was great. Dessert was the best! Chocolate mousse cheesecake, it was the first time I ever considered ordering a second dessert! Will definitely return. Service was great, Cody was on the ball. Noise level was pretty high.

The Grotto is inside the Golden Nugget, which by the way is nicer than I expected.  I hadn't been to Fremont St. in over 5 years so it was a nice surprise.

We had a group of 5 and decided on The Grotto from the help of yelp! Couldn't have been more thankful.  We were starving and this fit the bill.  Food was great.  I had a pizza (sausage & peppers), my buddies had the bruschetta appetizer, penne & meatballs and ravioli.  Pizza's are wood fired and baked with thin crust.

We only had the pizzas and Caesar salad.  The salad is nice enough, nothing extraordinary about it.  We really liked the pizza fresh ingredients, thin crust pizzas. The service was decent also nothing spectacular but got the job done.  Very good pizza but my choice would be to go to Pizza Rock.
Our food came out cold.  I have a strict policy of not sending food back so ate cold lasagne.  Was still tasty.

Up until today this has been my favorite place to eat.   The food was cold.   It took so long to get out to our table of two,  I was very upset I didn't bother to send it back.   This place has gone down hill.
Great restaurant and service at this nice Italian Bistro in the Golden Nugget Downtown. We sat looking out at the pool at dusk.  Great good,  service and views. Highly Recommended!

Great food but a couple of things happened.   A glass of ice was spilled and a wine glass broke due to the wait staff.  Not a big deal.   Manager brought a free app but waiter failed to ever bring us the app we ordered. Food took a long time to arrive. Would recommend anyways.

This was definitely the surprise meal of the trip. We went here out of convenience and turned out to be wonderful food. I had the italian sausage rigatoni - it was excellent, gf had the roasted herb chicken pizza and loved it. The italian wedding soup was the only flop - probably the worst I have had (especially for 7 bucks). Dessert was great.

The only thing keeping this from a 5 star review is that we were given someone else's leftovers. We got back to our room later expecting to have some late night pizza and realized we had someone else's leftover dessert.

My boyfriend and I ate here late in the evening (9:30-ish) so the restaurant was fairly empty.  We were seated by the pool area and even though the pool was closed, we could still see the fish swimming around in the tank.

We ordered a pizza (chicken with goat cheese and other things...can't remember the exact name) and entree sized salad to split among the two of us and I had a glass of wine.  The food was excellent and even though we were stuffed, we had to finish the pizza!

The only negative was that it took our waiter forever to come to our table.  We waited probably 10 minutes for him to even come take our drink orders...when he came, we quickly put in our whole order.  It also took a while for him to come at the end of the meal.
Spaghetti and meatballs was excellent , real meat in the meatballs , great bread too. Ate while playing poker at the golden nugget! I recommend trying
Food is good but the wait staff is VERY SLOW and the Hostess is RUDE'. Won't go back.
The bread is the only thing delicious here. Service was poor,, Cesar Salad taste rotten!! Fettuccine chicken was bland!
The bartenders are great and always make our late lunches amusing. The pizza chef manning the oven is an artist. Also, the cheese pizza is addictive. Plus there are happy hour food deals. I'm a fan!

It was my first time at Grotto inside the elegant Golden Nugget Hotel & Casino.  I was pleased with its welcoming and informal look, and ready for a fine Italian meal.  The Italian bread in the bread basket was okay.  So were the two meatballs that I had for an appetizer.  One was medium and the other medium-well in doneness.  The mild Marinara Sauce that accompanied the meatballs was quite good.  And, a Half Caesar Salad featuring chopped Romaine Lettuce was nice and cheesy.  

My mushroom-covered main dish of Veal St. Pietro in a very tasty cream sauce was nice and hot, and very good.  Sauteed Spinach and Roasted Potatoes accompanying this dish were also tasty but warm rather than hot.

Service was very good and on target throughout my stay.  This dinner ended on a high note with an excellent tasting, large slice of Mezza Notte Chocolate Fudge Cake and Vanilla Gelato for me, and excellent Tiramisu with Vanilla Cream for Diane.  Both desserts were very rich and decadent!
Food was cold, food is mediocre. Unless you're drunk or have no taste buds this might be your spot. Pizza was good at least that's the only thing that gave this a 3

Last night around 7:30, eight o'clock. Me and my family decided to grab a bite to eat for dinner at The Grotto since Giada and Guy's resturant reviews were horrible. 

The night starts with us arriving and the hostess giving us a wait time of an hour and forty-five minutes for a table of 5. Their was plenty of tables available to sit us and the other families that they were turning around with children. They tell us the wait was long due to a large party they had coming in of 18 and 20. Long story short the manager Neill seats us and our waiter Santos were the highlight of our service. Santos was johnny on the spot along with numerous other waiter that was walking around the resturant. The food was excellent, it was the best authentic Italian food that I had since I left Italy. The wedding party of 20 that was making everyone go elsewhere to eat was late and we ate, paid our check and leaving before they sat down. Will I return it depends on if the dirty blonde curly haired hostess is still their. The Manager Neill OUTSTANDING job for taking care of customers.

Nestled inside the bustling Golden Nugget Casino and Hotel, this Italian eatery boasts the staples, like pizza, chicken parm, caprese salad...you get the gist. Though, I usually appreciated open quality of all the restaurant casinos in Vegas, this spot was a little too open to the guests moving in out of the Golden Nugget. It's no shocker when people are havin a good time in Vegas. Even being drunk at 2pm is a normal circumstance. I guess it's just not always appreciated while you're trying to enjoy a nice midday salad. Especially when you are there at the restaurant to escape the craziness that comes in out of the casino.

Don't get me wrong, I realize I need to stop by belly aching. It's Vegas after all: I just need to get used to it or get out; however the interruptions were incessant. If the restaurant was just a tad more closed off, it would be a quaint restaurant with actually very delicious food. In fact, the pizza sizes are generous and the Italian Chopped salad is topped with a lot of grilled chicken. The server was incredibly nice and patient with my parents who can be a tad overwhelming with requests.

Who knew gin and tonics and mussels are so good together! We highly recommend getting that when you go here. 

We didn't have much else so I can't comment too much on the place. 

We had set our stuff down at a table and never saw a waiter so we assumed we had to order at the bar. I left my purse on a chair and went two steps away to the bar and magically a waitress appeared straightening chairs. Well..she joked that my purse was at one of her tables, but I got the distinct vibe I should move my bag. So...we sat at the bar and had a great time. The bartender was super friendly, I think his name was Michael.

Poop on you angry waitress lady! 

Poop on you.

Joined a friend halfway through dinner so just ended up getting dessert.  I have to say I was very surprised when the waitress brought me the dessert menu only cuz it wasn't a dessert menu at all.  It was a towering cart of desserts! Although they all did look yummy it was overkill and I had to hold back laughing as she was trying to maneuver this thing around tables! 
This dessert cart is not needed and a menu would have been fine :-)
Came here with my girl., food was savory and for a good price. Staff where friendly. I recommend this place.

We took a trip to Las Vegas for my 50th birthday.  We saw a lot of sights, went to see the Million Dollar Piano concert featuring Elton John.......gambled, drank and ate at a bunch of restaurants.  By far the best food, drinks and service we received over the course of our time in Las Vegas was at The Grotto.

The Grotto is an Italian restaurant in the Golden Nugget Hotel and casino in downtown Las Vegas, right in the heart of the Fremont Street Experience.  Before I go any further I want to recognize our server, Ricardo.  WOW!!  Ricardo provided perhaps the best service I have experienced at any restaurant in my 50 year lifetime.  Super friendly, super accommodating, knowledgeable and efficient.  A perfect gentleman, and helped make this night memorable for all in our party.

Drinks were ordered (with Ricardo's help/input), and they were all amazing!  Dinner was ordered (once again with Ricardo's helpful knowledge and suggestions/flexibility), absolutely no complaints about the food.  In fact, once the entrees came our table became quiet for the first time as everyone was eating, and trying each others selections.  Complete satisfaction!  

My sister in law apparently had told Ricardo that it was my birthday, so after the main course, here he comes with a piece of an amazing dessert which featured angel food cake and whipped cream (and much more).  We all tried it, and although no one was really very hungry, we ordered two more desserts; a piece of cheesecake and tiramisu for the table.  The cheesecake was the big winner of the three, by the way.

Overall, a huge shout out to The Grotto for providing an unforgettable evening.  Another huge shoutout to Ricardo.  I am positive that you should be recognized by your management for being such an outstanding server/employee.  I know that when we visit Las Vegas in the future, we'll be dining at The Grotto, and asking if Ricardo still works there.

Excellent dinner and even better service! The kids loved their spaghetti and meatballs. The dang meatballs were the size of softballs and very tasty! We shared the seafood pasta which was outstanding as was the lobster bisque. Oh, and the bread.....the best I've ever had!

A real surprise for a hotel restaurant!

we happened to stroll by and decided to stop in for dessert.  we loved the view of the pool area and the desserts were amazing.  it was a very busy friday night but even though we were only having dessert the wait staff was very attentive and efficient.  we'll definitely be going back.

Best meal I had in Vegas (well expect maybe Wicken Spoon but its hard to compete with bottomless mimosas with unlimited food...). We went to a highly rated, celebrity chef owned/supported Italian restaurant just before visiting Grotto and man did Grotto restore my faith in the quality of Vegas food.

The pastas were perfectly cooked with delicious sauces. My pizza was soft, well appointed with toppings, and had awesome cheese. Our server almost seemed insulted when each of us said "stop" for our fresh grated Parmesan (I promise I had plenty on my pizza).

All the servers were wonderfully friendly and helpful. I do wish that they had done a bit better job cleaning the table (some splattered sauce specs were still visible), but it was not terrible considering we were at bar seating. The prices were reasonable for the amount of food and even though there was a wait we were accommodated in the bar area fairly quickly!

Definitely would return here if I needed to know I was getting a good meal in Vegas. Sadly there are just too many options to just pick one.

Had lunch. So good. Sat in a table looking out at pool. Good people watching. Had tomato basil soup and meatball appetizer, both of which were awesome. Bread basket was great too. Perfect bread - crispy crust and soft middle. If I came back, I'd order that again. My husband's order was messed up, so they brought him some lobster bisque to enjoy while he waited for his correct meal. Nice touch. Great service. Not too impressed with the lobster bisque, but he liked his steak and Parmesan panini. I'd come back here for sure.

The food was poor quality. We also didn't know it was inside of a casino. We literally sat 2 feet from people smoking cigarettes at slot machines. It made for an even worse experience. My friend ordered a pasta dish that tastes like pure lemon zest. We ordered a side of Alfredo sauce to try and cover it up, it didn't work, she didn't eat.

Holy cow, our meal was a 10!!!  We all had different entrees and everyone loved their dish.  I had a lightly breaded chicken with lemon and caper sauce, it was AMAZING!  My son's pizza was very inexpensive ($5?) and he loved it.  My other son's penne with red sauce was also inexpensive but a very small portion.  I ended up spooning my side (noodles) over to his dish; we were both full and happy.  The strawberry cake was also huge and to die for, delish, really great.  Service would be my only complaint.  Our server was REALLY quite, or he hated us, one or the other.  He would hardly acknowledge or speak to us, we were not sure if he was really shy or what but our food made up for everything.  I would say that I was not impressed that once we left the table he ran over to check the bill/tip, a bit cheap in my eyes, especially for such a nice place.  Make a reservation if you can, and go ready to eat.  Enjoy!!
